26001.description:
From the box:

The Star Wars Vehicles Starter Set adds a new dimension to your Star Wars Miniatures Battles games with vehicle combat rules, vehicle miniatures and advanced game scenarios. Do you have what it takes to lead your troops to victory?

Basically a repackaging of the Star Wars Miniatures Battles Companion, West End added some sample miniatures and dice to round out this boxed set.

Includes:

Star Wars Miniatures Battles Companion
Rebel snow speeder miniature
Speeder bike w/ Rebel pilot miniature
Speeder bike w/ Imperial pilot miniature
5 6-sided dice

Expands:

Star Wars Miniatures Battles
26001.name: Star Wars Miniatures Battles: Vehicles Starter Set

26003.description:
This includes three expansions for GIPF.

Contents:


6 YINSH-potentials for each player
6 PÜNCT-potentials for each player
3 extra basic pieces for each player


See the project GIPF wiki page for more details on the potentials' powers.

The YINSH-potential can slide off its piece, any number of empty spots, for sneaky deployment. The PÜNCT-potential can land atop certain other pieces (different ones than the DVONN-potential), changing their color, or possibly introducing more GIPF-pieces mid-game!

GIPF Set 3 contains 6 white and 6 black YINSH-potentials, 6 white and 6 black PÜNCT-potentials, and 3 white and 3 black extra basic pieces to play "Ultimate GIPF". For the very brave amongst players: that is GIPF with 21 basic pieces and all 5 different kinds of potentials.

This is probably the last part of Project GIPF - after all those years players can combine all games :)

First product of cooperation of Kris Burm with company SMART.
26003.name: GIPF Project Set 3

26004.description:
Expansion kit for the popular Bitter Woods (fourth edition). Includes full color rulebook, 1/2 counter sheet, 3 expansion cards.

Expands:

Bitter Woods (fourth edition)
26004.name: Bitter Woods (4th Edition) Expansion Kit
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge

26005.description:
Miko Expansion Deck

The Miko Matches her spiritual power with her mental and physical strength to fulfil her destiny.

The Miko is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Rise of the Shogun, an epic battle for feudal Japan. The Miko can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Expands

HeroCard Rise of the Shogun
26005.name: HeroCard Rise of the Shogun Miko Expansion Deck

26006.description:
Prince Expansion Deck

The Prince uses bribes, dirty tricks, and court intrigue in his quest for power.

The Prince is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Rise of the Shogun, an epic battle for feudal Japan. The Prince can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Expands

HeroCard Rise of the Shogun
26006.name: HeroCard Rise of the Shogun Prince Expansion Deck

26007.name: Linie
26007.description:
"Linie" is played on a unusual board: 4 spiraled lines in 4 colors lead from every edge of the board to the center. These 4 spirals are intersected by 4 straight diagonals leading from the center to the edges.

The game includes 3 tokens per color/player, 1 die of each of these colors and 2 neutral white dice.

Movement is very unusual again, since a player can move any token on the board! During a turn, a player rolls 5-6 dice and each die roll allows the move of 1 token, using the white dice as jokers, who allow the movement of a token of any color.

Captures are possible on the diagonal lines only and the player who is the first to reach the center with all his 3 tokens is the winner of the game.

26008.name: Banco
26008.description:
This card game consists of a huge deck of 132 cards and 25 letter chips.
100 of the 132 cards are coupons, showing a letter and a value of 10 or 50. The rest of the deck has 32 cards of 11 different types, such as gold-barrels, bank robbers, guards, policemen and others.

Before the game starts, 3 letter chips are drawn; they form the combination, which is needed to open the bank safe.

During the game, the players play cards on 3 different places of the table: their own playing area, the bank-safe or around the bank-safe (to protect the safe).

The game ends, when the bank safe is either opened with the correct combination or successfully robbed by a bank robber.

Points are calculated to determine the winner - the bank safe is likely to give the most points, but cards on the playing areas and cards still in the hands are calculated also.

26009.name: Starchec
26009.description:
Starchec is actually a 2-games box with 2 different games in it. Common to both games is the use of 6-sided chess-die showing the 6 chess symbols: knight, bishop, rook, pawn, queen and king. Each turn, the die is rolled and allows 1 playing piece to make a chess move according to the roll of the die.

Starchec-1, Wettlauf um die Sterne (race around the stars):


2-4 players can play. Each player has 1 "saucer" and 1 "meteor". Object of the game is to be the first player, who brings his saucer to the finish line. Meteors are used to block opponent saucer; they can only be moved, when a king is rolled, but the can be placed everywhere on the board then. If a saucer captures another saucer, the 2 involved saucers just change places.

Starchec-2, Spiel im Weltall (game in outer space):


This game is played on a normal chessboard. Each of the 2 players has 8 tokens, which are placed on two opposing sides of the board. Winner of the game is the player, who brings all 8 tokens on the opposing side of the board first. Captures result in an exchange of positions again, but it's also allowed to "capture" own pieces, if a player does not want to move any of his tokens.

26010.name: König Krösus
26010.description:
The gameboard shows 5 rows of 8 spaces. The rows are numbered from 100-500 and marked 500-2500 at the side.

The 40 spaces of the board are filled with 1 coin of different values. During a turn, a player must take 1 coin from the bottom and he can place any number of coins back. When a coin is placed back on the board, the sidewards marked amount of money is collected.

Winner of the game is the player who has earned 50,000 first.

Apparently developed from The Economy Game reducing it to the pure and basic mechanism.

boardgamehonor: 2004 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
26011.description:
A three dimensional palm tree contains a number of coconuts in different colors. The goal is to climb up to the top of the palm with your ape by clever use of the coconut counters.

There are a number of chits; most show a coconut, a few an elephant. The player in turn flips a chit. If it shows a coconut, he may climb up to the next one with the same color. If it shown an elephant, he falls back a bit.

A good memory is necessary to know where the best coconuts are. The chits are moved from one area into the other each time they are displayed, and you can't use the same chip again until all of the chits have been used.
26011.name: Auf die Palme, ihr Affen

26012.name: Wahlparty
26012.description:
This game was published as a supplement for Fairplay, a German print magazine for games. Wahlparty is a small booklet and you have to cut all cards and built a box out of the booklet by yourself.

Wahlparty is an election game in the political system of "Bundesrepublik Deutschland". You have to collect set of card for 16 federal states and gain the majority.

26013.name: The Supers
26013.description:
In a world where heroes are an everyday sight, do you have what it takes to fight for your time in the limelight? Can you prove your powers and abilities or are you just another weirdo in spandex?

In The Supers, you decide just that! The Supers is a fast paced, easy to learn card game for 2 to 6 players! Build your own hero with the help of a variety of Powers, Gadgets, Tactics and Places and take on your friends in a head-to-head, one on one battle or get six (or more!) people together for a battle royale!

26014.name: The Imp Game
26014.description:
For years, players of fantasy games have stormed the dungeons and strongholds of evil sorcerers, warlords, and just plain bad guys as heroes: knights, wizards, druids, paladins, and more. Heroically they have braved the darkest pits, the foulest creatures, and the most perilous of quests.

This, however, is not such a game.

Welcome to The Imp Game! Rather than taking on the role of one of these namby-pamby heroes, players in the Imp Game take on a much more entertaining role: that of the common, dungeon imp! Servants of a wannabe dark and quasi-evil overlord, players scour the world in search of items of power, foil the plots of “evil” Adventurers, and clean out the dungeons whenever needed, getting themselves into mess after mess with the only way out is to help each other!

The Imp Game is a wonderfully hilarious game for 2 to 5 players of all ages. The Imp Game features a powerful "Failure" mechanic that captures the feeling of inept but stupidly lucky sidekicks, ensuring that success is inevitable, but who succeeds at what?

26015.name: Terre Invisibili
26015.description:
Self-producted fantasy boardgame.

Every player has a character represented by a counter on the game map.

Players try to increase the features (strength, agility, stamina, mind and... money) of their characters according to the classical fantasy setting (wander, have encounters, fight the monsters, take the gold).

The final goal is to find and piece together the fragments of the Wand and become ruler of the lands.

Rules and cards are only in Italian.

"Terre Invisibili" means "Invisible Lands" in English.

26016.name: Wehrmacht: Fifth Blitzkrieg
26016.description:
"Wehrmacht:Fifth Blitzkrieg" There are two 59 x 84 cm map stretching from Leningrad (included) to the Caucasus, so the whole Eastern Front, except the Finnish front and a bit of the most Western parts of the Soviet Union which were overrun in Summer 1941 at the beginning of Operation Barbarossa (printed in Japanese) and 22 pages of rules (in Japanese).
720 counters: units are divisions for the Germans and Axis allies plus separate tiger tank companies, tank and infantry armies, tank, mechanized and cavalry corps for the Soviets. Players can play from May 1942 to March 1943, the battle of Kharkov of May 1942, Operation Blue on June 1942 or the Russian counterattack of November 1942 leading to the Stalingrad encirclement and von Manstein counter stoke of February-March 1943.
Very beautiful components.

For one or two players.
Playing time: about eight hours.

26017.name: Space Checkers
26017.description:
Space Checkers is a strategy game for two to four players, ages 8 to adult. Each player tosses two dice, one that indicates the number of spaces to move (1 to 6), and the other that indicates which direction to move (East, West, North, South, or WILD).

Additionally, you can warp your playing pieces from one side of the board to the other (Horizontal and Vertically).

To win, just capture ten of your opponent’s playing pieces.

Approximate playing time is between 30 and 60 minutes — depending on the number of players.

26018.name: HappyAnimals
26018.description:
HI! I am the Pig and I am HAPPY near the Farm and near the Water. If I stop on other places... I become SAD! When Happy I can draw the YELLOW HAPPY NUMBERS, and when Sad I can draw the PURPLE SAD NUMBERS!

MOOO! I am the Cow and I am HAPPY near the Farm and near the Grass: On these places I can draw THREE HAPPY NUMBERS and if i draw a "+", then I can sum them! With 5 + 4, I can move up to 9 squares!

Who will be an HAPPY ANIMAL?
Who will arrive first? Maybe someone will stop on a square to stay happy and draw the HAPPY NUMBERS, higher than the SAD NUMBERS!
The choice is yours: always run till the last step or stay happy and win!

HAPPYANIMALS is a COMPLETE GAME
for 2-18 players, 5 years and up. Contents:
- 18 Cards with the characteristics of all Animals
- 18 Counters of the Animals, The Happy Numbers and the Sad Numbers
- 1 Board representing the race map with the Farm, the Woods, the Grass, the Water...
- 1 Rule sheet easy (draw and move) and one with addictions, subtractions, multiplications and divisions.
- And... 2 wooden PUSH PUPPETS!

All the 18 wooden push puppets are available:
Pig, Cow, Lion, Donkey, Elephant, Dog, Cat, Giraffe, Gazzelle, Husky, Leopard, Green Dog, Bear, Sheep, Monkey, Bamby, Horse, Zebra.

Push puppets are wonderful handmade and hand-painted animals that when "Happy" stands on their base, when "Sad" flop on their legs!

HAPPYANIMALS will be premiered as prototype at EssenFair 06, Stand SilToys booth number 9-19 and at stand Angelo Porazzi Games booth number 9-28.

26019.name: Spot Cash
26019.description: Each player secretly places his collection of tiles face down on a triangular board. The covered half of the tiles have different colors and different denominations. Each denomination must be placed in a certain pattern on the board. Players then turn over the tiles on other boards, earning a multiple of the denomination. Red tiles score for the player who turned over the tile, black tiles score for the player who owns the tile. Each turn ends when a black tile is uncovered. The game ends when all tiles have been uncovered, and the player with the most money wins. This is an interesting but (seemingly) forgotten game from one of the largest publishers. The game is similar to Battleship, but with much more depth.

26021.name: NAQ
26021.description: NAQ, pronounced "Knack", is a party game where all players become trivia buffs because the trivia is based on the knowledge of the players in the game. A fun, fast-paced party game where you can mix people with different levels of education and cultures with everyone having an equal chance of winning. More information available at http://www.naqgames.com/index2.html

26022.name: Moneyworld Inve$tor
26022.description:
From the back of the box:

Now, you can be a Global Investor! Buy and sell currencies, properties, commodities, production plants and shops. Collect rent and make profits. Yes, make a billion dollars! But to win, you n eed to make good decisions, form partnerships, be prudent, take risks; and, most of all, have balance in your life. So,.. Go.. get it!

Investing is... "The greatest game in the world" according to Mr. Barton Briggs, head of Morgan Stanley Asset Management, and one of the world's biggest international money managers.
This boardgame deals with issues related to the world economy and global investment. Design for
- families who love to play together,
- parents who wish to impart values and skills for future success,
- students for interactive learning, and
- friends in a mood for indoor fun.

INVE$TOR is:
Educational - young people learn about global economic issues, market trends and money management. They learn to plan ahead, make wise decisions, change with the times, take calculated risks, form partnerships, and have a balanced life.
Fun and Entertaining - the whole family, and friends, of ages 12 & up, may enjoy interacting, collaborating and competing with one another through a game that is never the same everytime you play it!

26023.description:
I Spy Bingo is a bingo game based on the 'I Spy' picture books by Walter Wick and Jean Marzollo. The bingo boards (4 space by 4 space) are double-sided - one side with the letters in sequence for beginning players and the reverse side with randomly arranged letters. Each bingo card square contains pictures of objects beginning with the letter in the square. The letter cards are also two-sided - the beginner's side features the letter to be called out, and the "advanced" side only contains pictures whose names are to be called out and the first letter of the word used. Per the game box, ages 4+ are appropriate for the game.

From the game box: "Popular I Spy pictures become a fast and fun bingo game...get 4 in a row and shout Bingo!
* Players learn beginning sounds and practice reading skills.
* Promotes manual dexterity, verbal and visual skills.
* Two levels of play."
26023.name: I Spy Bingo

26024.name: Stranded
26024.description:
In Stranded, Time Machine travel takes you to great events in American history! From the Mayflower's landing at Plymouth Rock to the Wright Brothers' takeoff at Kitty Hawk. From Paul Revere's biggest date to the Gold Rush of '48. But the trick is: getting from one to the other without getting stuck! Fun and suspense mount as every move makes return to the present a little bit tougher. Simple but well-timed strategies are key to being the last remaining player and winner of the game. Fast-paced, friendly, and educational too, STRANDED is for 2 to 4 players, ages 8 to adult. Approximate playing time is 30 minutes.

Contents: 1 Game Board, 1 Set of Rules, 4 Movers, 1 Color Die, and 48 Colored Time Machine Circles.

26025.name: Tumba
26025.description:
The game involves placing wooden pieces on a tower, each piece consisting of a line of 5 colored cubes in different arrangements, so that each piece touches the piece(s) below it only where the colors match. The player who is unable to place a piece or who knocks the tower down is eliminated.

The game comes with a solid wooden plinth to place the first piece on, 60 wooden pieces and a large cloth bag to draw them from.

26026.name: Devil's Deeds
26026.description:
From the Rules :

"There is a job open in hell for a nasty devil like you. But you has grown to like working on earth and desperately wants to avoid going down to hell again. You must be bad enough to keep your job, but not bad enough to get a new job. A devilish challenge."

A card game made by a new Swedish designer.

26027.description:
From the Website:

"You are only Traffic Controller at Edward C. Eagle Airport and there are zillions of planes coming your way.

You would scream if you were not busy directing planes. "

A game of panic control.

Each player is playing a Traffic Controller and the goal of the game is to be the last traffic Controller left in the game. You must make sure that no planes collide, easier said than done.
26027.name: Happy Landing

26028.name: Feeeeed Meeeee
26028.description:
From the Rules:
"Feeeeed Meeeee is the most popular game among the Big Trolls. The rules are simple: Big Trolls sit around a table loaded with food.. but they are not allowed to eat! As time passes, they get hungrier and hungrier. The first Big Troll that can´t control his hunger and starts to eat the food is the loser"

You must collect sets of food cards. This is done by rolling 2 dice to determine how many action points you get for the turn. With these action points you move to different storage places and collect food.

The Swedish edition, called Glufs Glufs, was included in issue 5/2006 of the Swedish games magazine Fenix.

26029.name: Knatsch: Das Turnierspiel
26029.description:
Knatsch - the tournament play
for 3 to 5 players, approx.. 20 minutes.

A New Print & Play Game From Michael Schacht on his Spiele aus Timbuktu Web site.

Once in the year the king organizes a gigantic tournament. The participants argue about the favor of the castle and about the profit of castles. The player with most points of fame wins the tournament.

26030.description:
Scrabble Junior: The Disney Edition is (as the name would suggest) a Disney-themed version of the Scrabble Junior family. The game features a two-sided gameboard and 101 letter tiles. The words to be created are printed on the gameboard, and the players take turns placing up to two letters per turn onto those words, always placing the next letter of the word in order. Points are scored for being the player to place the letter tile that completes a word. The game is obviously aimed at children (ages 5+, per the box).

From the game box: "Match up letters to create popular Disney words! Can you spell out Jasmine? Or maybe you can finish the word Simba. Use your letter tiles to build crosswords on the picture-filled game board. Each time you finish a word, you get a scoring chip. When all of the tiles are played, the one with the most chips wins! Have twice the fun with the two-sided board. Flip over the board and build words like Mirror and Fawn."
26030.name: Scrabble Junior: The Disney Edition

26031.name: The Compleat Strategyst
26031.description:
An analysis of "matrix games" where each player has a set of "strategies" to choose from - these are just labels, could be rock/paper/scissors - and there are pre-arranged "payoffs" according to which strategies are chosen. Prisoner's Dilemma is a well-known example of such a "game". Or, consider the following example, paraphrased from the text.

Aldie and Derk decide to play a game for daiquiris. Each throws one or two fingers. If both throw one finger, Aldie buys Derk a daiquiri. If both throw two fingers, Derk buys Aldie two daiquiris. If they don't match, Aldie pays Derk a dime. (At the time this book was written, daiquiris were 55 cents.) How much per game should Derk demand of Aldie in order to make this game worthwhile?

This text can help you solve this problem, or others like it. In particular, this is the type of game theory floating around behind certain sports simulations like Football Strategy or MLB SportsClix, although the latter has dice as well as the strategy selection.

26032.name: Donald Duck Card Game
26032.description: This game appears to be one of a set of games that were produced in small, matchbox sized boxes. The game looks like a small book, and has Vol 1. on the spine, which suggests that there may be others in the set. There is no publication date, but this is probably fairly old.

26033.name: Maratón Clásico
26033.description:
A Mexican trivia game that was quite popular some years ago. Up to six players or teams can play. The players advance in a track of 42 spaces (or "kilometers", hence the name of the game) by answering questions about six main themes. A black piece represented the runner from the "Ignorance Country", a special player that advances every time nobody answers a question.

Because of the game's popularity, more editions were published: "Maratón Junior", for younger players with easier questions; "Maratón de los Famosos", with questions about celebrities of TV, sports, and music; "Mi primer Maratón", a very basic edition for children; and "Maratón con Opciones", a variant with 3 answers for each question, where players try to choose the correct option.

26034.name: Zeon
26034.description: Abstract strategy game created for the "Learn & Play a New Game" tournament held during FirenzeGioca (="FlorencePlays") 2004

26035.name: From the Casebook of Michael Collins' Dan Fortune
26035.description:
From the cover "Play Dan Fortune, the one armed detective featured in the novels and stories of Michael Collins. He is a master at solving cases in which no foul play is obvious. Enjoy this exciting supplement to Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine Game.

Uncover Hidden Evidence in these four challenging mysteries:

Would Dan Fortune turn down a beautiful women's request for help? In A Shot in the Dark, the detective assists a lady in distress.

Have the police arrested the wrong man? When there is A Death in the Greenhouse, the master detective must prove that the suspect is innocence.

When Dan Fortune vacations in Bromlee Station, three college students ask the sleuth to find their missing roommate. Are these young men overreacting, or is their friend The Missing Physicist?

Can working late at the office be fatal? Perhaps so, in The Embezzler's Revenge.

26036.name: Race the Moon
26036.description:
The object of this game is to plant the tulip garden before the moon is full. Each turn the player rolls the dice and can plant a tulip of the color rolled. If the moon is rolled, the player must add a moon piece to the central moon puzzle. If the moon is complete before any gardens are planted then the moon wins.

The game has a co-operative aspect in that if a player rolls a tulip color that they already have in their garden then they may donate the tulip to a different player. No player may have two tulips of the same color in their garden.

The game is crafted from wooden components.

26037.description:
Abstract strategy game created for the "Learn & Play a New Game" tournament held during FirenzeGioca (="FlorencePlays") 2006

It is freely downloadable.
26037.name: Brazil

26038.name: Tri-Memo: The Lord of the Rings – The Two Towers
26038.description: This game is an average run of the mill memory game with a twist. In the game you are trying to match characters from the Lord of the Rings Two Towers movie. Instead of finding a matched pair on your turn you must find a matched trio of pictures. This makes the game somewhat more difficult than the traditional matched pair style of gameplay. Don't fret though, rules are included to play the routine memory style game of matching pairs. The game was published by BETEXA which is in the Czech Republic. FEVA, located in the United Kingdom, was the distributor. This game is hard to find and most likely would appeal to collectors of Lord of the Rings themed games.

26039.description: Goalsystem Fantasy (GSF) is a complete fantasy skirmish system designed for 28mm miniatures play. It features the basics of combat, movement, and character creation. The game also includes rules for magic and scenarios. GSF is powered by the Goalsystem, the same rules that run SuperSystem and Chaos In Cairo. If you have never tried a Goalsystem game, this is a great way to do it. All you need are 3-5 figures per side, and a handful of six-sided dice. Color cover and fifteen pages.
26039.name: Goalsystem Fantasy

26041.name: Kellogg's (Ten Pin) Bowling
26041.description:
From the rules: "If you don't know or understand bowling, this game will teach you. If you do know bowling, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

Simplistic playing card driven game. I believe I got the games from Pop-Tart boxes. I am aware of 8 games in the series.

26042.name: Kellogg's Professional Basketball
26042.description:
From the rules: "If you don't know or understand basketball, this game will teach you. If you do know basketball, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

Simplistic playing card driven game. I believe I got the games from Pop-Tart boxes. I am aware of 8 games in the series.

26043.name: Triple Match
26043.description:
Contents
* 2 Game Boards
* 48 Colored Plastic Marbles - 6 each of 8 colors
* 1 Indicator Shaker

Aim of the game:
To set up as many patterns as possible on your individual board, that match the little shaker pattern.

26044.name: Torment
26044.description: Crossword game. Cards provide categories and three different grids allow for different levels of play. Players fill in the blank grids "across" first for five points each and then add "down" answers for ten points each. A bonus is added for completing the grid. Includes pads of grids, pencils, eraser and "egg timer".

26045.name: Rockets Away: Sensational Space Travel Game
26045.description: In this classic game from the 1950s, players take turns launching rockets at a board containing futuristic space settlements and various celestial objects, such as planets, stars, and a sun. Launching occurs by placing the rockets in rocket launcher attached to a space station and then dropping the rockets on the board from above. Players score points or lose points based on where the rockets land. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

26046.name: Steve Scott Space Scout: A Game of Adventure in Outer Space
26046.description: In this game, players select a color for their rockets and then go on a mission to explore the solar system.

26047.description: Civilization: The Card Game simulates the rise of empires as in the computer game Civilization. Players will collect resources, obtain lands, construct Buildings and Wonders, discover Technologies, and fight enemies on their way to victory. The game ends when the final Technology is bought, and the player with the most Victory Points (one each per Wonder, Technology, and Population) is declared the Winner. If Victory Points are tied, then the Winner is the player with the most Technologies. If Technologies are tied, then the Winner is the player with the most Population.
26047.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 379 - Civilization The Card Game, Little Prince, and Keythedral

26048.name: Merry Motorist Game
26048.description:
This game is a race to the finish. Several pitfalls and twists and turns await your journey home. This game is similar to an advanced chutes and ladders as some paths let you skip past sections and others send you back. Action cards also affect your play along the way.

The board itself is a giant puzzle and comes in 6 large pieces that fit together to form the board.

26049.name: One on One Basketball
26049.description: A simulation of one-on-one basketball featuring NBA stars, playground greats, Harlem Globetrotters, and other famous players. Players are rated for five different shot types (jump, back-in, power, shake-n-bake, and drive), their ability to get a shot off for, their chance of making the shot, ability to defend each type of shot and overall defense, rebounding, blocks, steals, free throws, dunks and more. 308 players are rated for the game.

26050.name: Schuss the Skiing Boardgame
26050.description:
Schuss looks like it is becoming the new choice of after-dinner board gamers, pushing Trivial Pursuit off the table.

The board itself is designed like a piste map, with blue runs throwing up easy Alpine-related questions, with tougher questions on the testing blacks. Mountain restaurant stops help you to change runs and wipe-outs can have 'hilarious consequences' - with dares (why not make up your own?) in order for fallers.

Box Contents:
Mountain shaped playing board (60 x 40cms)
6 wooden playing pieces + 1 die
1 wooden shaker +1 wooden card holder (inspired by the shape of a bobsleigh!)
Schuss question cards (120 blue, 120 red and 120 black questions)
30 Schuss mountain restaurant cards
40 Schuss wipe-out dare cards (including 5 blanks to add your own dares!)

http://www.schuss.co.uk/

26051.name: A Day Full of Energy
26051.description:
Energy as a concept is not easy; scientists believe that the amount of energy in the universe is constant, not used up, but converted from one form to another. The original science through literacy resources (shown opposite) followed a family’s day and all the different types of energy they encountered: a day full of energy – from the energy inside them, to that found and used around them. Stimulating young children to understand the value of energy and how not to waste it, is vital. This boardgame has been developed as an extension to the resource pack and posters, following requests from teachers already using the material.

The game has been designed for use within the primary school, linking science and literacy at various skill levels. On the following pages, are not only background information, facts and ways to play the game, but also suggested variations and ideas for follow up activities.

26052.name: Canossa
26052.description:
Anno Domini 947 a. C. marks the royal marriage between Lothar II, King of Italy, and Adelaide of Burgundy. Unfortunately, soon after this union is sadden due to the death of the King. The belief is that the King was killed by Berengario II, Marquis of Ivrea, hungry to reign the Kingdom. Adelaide, indignant, opposes this new regency, as Berengario II tries to force her to marry his own son, Adalbert of Ivrea. She runs away to seek refuge in the Canossa Castle, strategic in its position, owned and governed by Azzo Adalbert. Here comes the siege of the castle, and this is what we are going to recall: on one side Berengario II and his son, Adalbert, are besieging, and on the other Adelaide of Burgundy and Azzo Adalbert are under siege; in defense of them comes Otho I, Emperor of Germany, with his knights. Each courageous player will guide 2 of the Emperor’s knights, to try to free Adelaide, allowing Otho I to marry her in 952, and thus becoming the new King of Italy.

Goal of the game is to achieve a higher score than your opponents. Points are achieved by either taking enemy tiles or creating a way out of the Canossa Castle (3 points).
Enemy tiles, like all other tiles, are captured when you place one of your knight-pawn on one of them. Captured tiles must always be perfectly visible to all other players.
The game ends when a player creates a way out of the Canossa Castle (that means to seize the Canossa Castle tile).
In order to seize the Canossa Castle tile or any other enemy tile players must create a way out that enables that tile, on which there’s the knight-pawn, to be moved off of the board.

26053.description: "Lowcy Zwierzat" (or "Animal hunters") is a print and play game where players move their pieces (hunters) on a hexagonal desert. Once 4 hunters are next to a hex with an animal that animal is captured by the player who has most hunters nearby. Hunters move one hex at a time unless they manage to form a group, which allows them to move about much more quickly.
26053.name: Łowcy Zwierząt

26054.name: Black Stories 3
26054.description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.
Part 3 with 50 new stories.

26055.description:
Twilight Imperium is a unique boardgame that allows players to control one of six different races and guide their faction to galactic control via political intrigue, warfare, trade, and technological progression. The game incorporates an original movable hexagon system design, ensuring no two games are alike.

The Second Edition incorporates a number of elements different from the original: new components, a new tech system, new action and political cards, new racial abilities, and new victory conditions.

Part of the Twilight Imperium Series.

Re-implements:

Twilight Imperium




Expanded by:

Twilight Imperium: Hope's End




Re-implemented in:

Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
26055.name: Twilight Imperium (second edition)

26056.name: NetResults
26056.description:
The Synestructics company sold the building toy of the same name, which was a set of hollow rods of various lengths and connectors with various numbers of prongs, which together could be combined to build three-dimensional frameworks.

NetResults is a game which uses Synestructic pieces - one type of connector and one size of rod (in three colors). Starting with a simple triangle, players take turns adding pieces to a common structure, attempting to complete polygons of any shape. Points are awarded for the polygons based on the number of edges, with extra points awarded for completing polygons that use pieces from other players.

The game can be played by 2-3 players as individuals and 4 or 6 players in teams of two.

26057.description:
This game was published in the May 1971 issue (Volume 3, Number 5) of Spartan International.

As indicated by the title, it is a wargame covering the fighting for Arnhem from September 17-25, 1944. It uses a fairly simple system, but does cover the salient points of the operation, including parachute drops, supply (including parachuted supplies), bridge blowing, etc.

In addition to the rules, the magazine includes an 11"x17" black and white map, an Order of Appearance sheet, 83 blue counters (German units and blown bridge markers), 44 beige counters (Allied units, air attack markers, and dropped supply markers), plus 1 more counter in each color which may or may belong to this game (the picture on each looks something like a mine). The counters are on paper and must be mounted and cut out
26057.name: Arnhem and Operation Market-Garden

26058.name: Denmark Straits
26058.description:
This game was published in the May 1971 issue (Volume 3, Number 5) of Spartan International.

It is a tactical naval game of the 1941 battle between the Bismarck and Prinz Eugen on one side and the Hood, Prince of Wales, Suffolk, and Norfolk on the other. It is really a set of miniatures rules, with counters provided to be used instead of ship miniatures. Six counters are included (one for each ship), sized for 1:1200 scale.

26059.name: Pythagoras
26059.description:
Ancient Greeks invent the board games (petties) and the most famous was "Pessoi" in many eras and with many differences.

Pythagoras of Samos is often described as the first pure mathematician. He is an extremely important figure in the development of mathematics yet we know relatively little about his mathematical achievements. Unlike many later Greek mathematicians, where at least we have some of the books which they wrote, we have nothing of Pythagoras's writings. The society which he led, half religious and half scientific, followed a code of secrecy which certainly means that today Pythagoras is a mysterious figure.

Pythagoras is the recreation of the Pythagorian "Pessoi".
This is a real ancient boardgame from ancient Hellas.

There is one board.
There are 2-6 players.
Each player has pawns.
Pawns must have the signs of ancient Greek letters.
Also there are three dice with ancient Greek shapes on them.
The player with the highest die roll plays first.
All pawns must enter the board make a word.

The board game Pythagoras has the following items:
1. A Colorful Board.
2. Pawns/letters different in color and shape for each of the players.
3. One to Three dice with different shapes on each one.
4. Many other items.

26060.name: Macedonia
26060.description:
Macedonia is an ancient region in Greece and also a board game of the "Pessoi".

The theme here is Greek Macedonia, one of the most beautiful regions of Greece, and an area which will grow in importance as the commercial and cultural center of the Balkans in the years to come.

This is an 2-6 player board game styled on ancient Macedonia with boards (petties) and ancient Greek letters from the Macedonian era. Each player has ancient letters from ancient Macedonia Greece. Also there are three dice with the ancient Macedonian shapes. Highest roll starts the game.

Macedonia has the following items:

1. Some Colorful Boards (Grids).
2. Ancient Hellenic Macedonian letters connected with numbers for each player (Aristotelian method).
3. Three dice with different shapes.
4. Other materials.
5. A leaflet with some information for this game along with photos from the ancient Macedonian region.

26061.name: Byzantium
26061.description:
Byzantium is the name given to both the state and the culture of the Hellenic Empire in the middle ages. Both the state and the inhabitants always called themselves Hellenes/Roman, as did most of their neighbors. Western Europeans, who had their own Roman Empire. The eastern Europeans called them Orientals or Greeks (Hellenes). Byzantion was the ancient name of the capital city and Byzantines gives the name of the Empire's capital city, as Constantinople (City of Constantinos the Emperor).

Byzantium is an ancient city in Greece and also a board game of Byzantium's "Pessoi".
This is an ancient board game from the ancient city of Byzantium with boards depicting the Byzantine era. Byzantium also called the Constantinople. Played with Byzantine Greek era letters for 2-6 players.
Also there are three dice with the ancient shapes of Byzantium.
Highest roll starts the game.

Byzantium has the following items:
1. Some Colorful Boards (Grids).
2. Byzantium letters connected with numbers for each player.
3. Three dice with shapes.
4. Other materials.
5. A leaflet with some information for this game along with photos from the Byzantine era.

26062.name: Cosmic Runar Dice
26062.description:
Cosmic Runar (Runic) Dice

In ancient Europe there was a very popular dice game with the name Cosmic Runar (Runic) Dice. At first at the Orpheus period was only three cosmic dice. At the Homeric period there were four dice. At last there were totally twelve dice, for the 12 Gods. The Europeans create the runar (runic) scripts, so the Cosmic Runar Dice created.

The game comes with 12 cosmic runar dice and the explanation for predicting your future according to the ancient Greek and European philosophers.
Also given is an explanation of how to use this game as a Rune Casting and fortune telling according to the scripts.

Cosmic Runar Dice has the following items:
1. A colorful grid.
2. 12 dice with runar (runic) scripts and letter.
3. A small book.
4. Many other items and a research book about runar script.

The full game which will be issued in the next version will have 25 cosmic dice and much more information about the ancient philosophy of fortune telling.

This board game have been proposed to The UK Parliament for Olympic games in London 2012.

26063.name: Napoléon à Austerlitz
26063.description:
Apparently, the first wargame made in France. Published by the designer (Jean-Pierre Défieux) in 1977.

Very simple French wargame about the famous battle. It uses the simple attacker/defender odds table with elimination, retreat or "exchange". No command system, no special rules, a good game to introduce novices to concept of ZOC, combat odds, movement points...Large color map, basic NATO counters blue for French, green for Russians and white for Austrians.

26064.description:
Shatranj is the predecessor to modern European Chess. The two games resemble each other, but Shatranj is different enough that they can be considered two distinct games, even though it is Shatranj that Europeans first called "chess".

The main differences between shatranj and modern chess are that the earlier game had a vizier instead of a queen, and an elephant instead of a bishop, and these pieces had much more limited movement than their modern counterparts. The pawn also lacked the double-step introductory move it has today, and furthermore, there was no castling.

While all this sounds very limiting, it can make a refreshing change from modern chess. Modern openings must be left behind, and the pace of the game is a little slower, the limited movement of the pieces allowing defenses to be set up before the opponent approaches to destroy them.
26064.name: Shatranj

26065.name: Quads
26065.description:
The game is something like the better-known game "Battleship." In this game the players mark three squares (of four places) that the other playing is trying to find by guessing. The boards are plastic coated on particle board and marked with a grease pencil.

It was also released as a pad of sheets to be used with a regular pencil (or possibly two pads in a box), which were more professionally produced.

26066.name: Moto-Cross
26066.description: This game is quite unique with its theme as it is about motor-cross, a discipline that game publishers typically overlook. The goal is to reach the finish first and to score the maximum number of points. Each player either controls 1 or 2 motor-cross bikes. Each team has a budget and the races consists of 2 matches, the winner is the player who has scored the highest number of points over the 2 matches. Apart from dice, the game also consists of cards and a 34 x 47 cm. board. Vintage game from the '80s.

26067.name: Kropki
26067.description:
Kropki (or "Dots" in English) is a paper and pencil game very popular play-during-lessons-in-school game. It seems this game was invented to play Go with paper and pencil - in contrast to Go you can surround empty spaces together with opponents dots, and the surrounded areas are off limits for the rest of the game. Go experience is helpful, but many tactics work differently.

There are Wikipedia articles in Polish and Russian and Czech.

You can also play online.

Here is an online interactive tutorial with problems to solve:
http://www.tochki.org/lesson/eng/index.html

26068.name: Traffic
26068.description:
Traffic is a game about traveling in Switzerland. The board shows a route of 45 spaces. 8 of them are petrol stations, which can be extended to service stations. The background of the board shows a detailed road map of Switzerland.

Each player travels across the route with a car, that can be chosen from 22 car cards. Some cars have cheaper upkeep costs than others, but they will reduce the income received when they land on the profitable bank spaces on the board. But money can also be earned through petrol/service stations, obtained by correctly answering the question cards as well as by chance cards and the possession of special star chips.

These star chips are the main objective of the game, because the first player having 70000 francs in money plus 7 star chips, wins the game.

Traffic comes with some unusual components. First, there is a plastic bar with 23 holes.
Rolling a glass marble in that bar replaces the roll of a die. Second, a 1.5 x 3 inch model car serves as challenge trophy. The winner gets this car until a next game is played. And third, 2x36 (traffic) question cards for children and adults are somewhat like a game in the game.

26069.name: A-divino
26069.description: A Mexican trivia game based on Catholic religion. Questions are divided in two groups: Practice and Culture; Practice questions refer to activities and behavior related to the Catholic Church, while Culture questions refer to historical and general knowledge questions that are somewhat related to Catholic religion.

26070.name: Multiplication Bingo
26070.description: Multiplication Bingo is an educational children's version of Bingo, designed to teach children multiplication, while retaining the flavor of Bingo.

26071.name: Le Wallon
26071.description: Players take on the role of Wally, the "mascot" Wallonia. Players roll and move around a map of Wallonia from city to city visiting specific sites before returning to the starting locality to finish play. Le Wallon is a children’s game meant to teach children about Wallonia, it's cities and it’s History.

26072.name: NOVENOPS!
26072.description:
(From publisher's website)

NOVENOP is an acronym created from the words NOun, VErb, NOun, and Phrase and is a board game for children of ages 6 and up. NOVENOPS! has 60 cards that help develop the player's ability to understand the basic elements of grammar. Gameplay is designed to continuously reinforce the sentence structure concepts...while word familiarity improves reading and writing skills. Not only is NOVENOPS! a great learning experience-it's a hilarious game!

26074.name: UNO: Vacation
26074.description:
WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Check Two Card.

When this Check Two Card played by a player, he/she can:
- immediately play another card of the same suit color, OR
- play either Wild or Wild Draw 4 Card, the wild color called must match the color of the Check Two Card played.

However, this Check Two Card cannot be played:
- on its own (without a card of the same suit color), OR
- as the last card in your hand.
If the Check Two Card is the last card in a player hand, he/she must take another card from the draw pile. If the card just drawn matches the suit color of the Check Two Card, he/she may directly play the Check Two Card, say UNO, and play the matching suit color card to complete the game.

26075.name: Action Front! Watchtower
26075.description:
ACTION FRONT! Watchtower is the first in a projected series of DTP microgames covering tactical combat in WWII. The game's expandable system is reminiscent of the venerable Panzerblitz/Panzer Leader games, with a feeling of the Five-Star series thrown in. Each game is played on 4 x 8 inch semi-geomorphic maps, with a fast, furious sequence of play that minimizes bookkeeping and maximizes the action. Players may play the included scenarios or create their own using the provided rules.

Watchtower comes with 20 US and 20 Japanese units, allowing players to recreate the epic struggle of the 1st US Marine Division on Guadalcanal in September and October of 1942. USMC Raiders and Paramarines square off against Chi-Ha tanks and leg mortars. Special rules are included for Henderson Field and banzai attacks.

In a small series with the Action Front! Hakko Ichiu.

26076.description: Take one of 4 bears and guide them through the spooky old tree. Help get them out by using their flashlight, stick, rope and key. First bear out wins.
26076.name: The Berenstain Bears Spooky Old Tree Game

26077.description: Race through the rooms of the museum, finding all the missing objects. If you are the first to find a dinosaur bone and return it to its proper place, you win!
26077.name: The Berenstain Bears Missing Dinosaur Bone Game

26078.name: Le Combat de l'Aigle
26078.description:
Le Combat de l’Aigle (The Eagle's fight) is a tactical game system meant to simulate Napoleonic battles at the battalion scale. Large size battles are playable in one day. The game mechanism is close to miniatures, but the armies are included in the box as are several scenarios on the beginning of the 1809 campaign. Other volumes will follow.

Several rules are very innovative; a focus on unit cohesion (visualized by file closers set behind the unit), the chain of command, a cavalry combat using waves of squadrons close to reality. Other elements, (e.g. the brigade move) can accelerate the game. The combat system is based on drawing cards and comparing them (a simpler system based on a single die roll is also included).

Le Combat de l’Aigle can be played three different ways :

* As a tactical system to simulate real or imaginary battles..
* As a miniature game system (Kip Trexel is the author of the campaign rules for Empire III). Basing and the use of miniatures, with single miniatures as file closers, are easy to adapt to any scale. Designed at first to be played with 6mm miniatures and doubling all distances included here, it can be converted to any scale with great ease..
* As a tactical extension of the Vol de l’Aigle campaign system, to solve every important battle. The players can decide to switch to a more tactical system when a large battle occurs.

The game includes 5 scenarios on the opening moves of the 1809 campaign.
Content (under ziplock):

* 1 rule book (32 pages).
* 18 hard paper counter sheets including the French and Austrian armies at the beginning of the 1809 campaign in Bavaria.
* 4 sheets of colorful player aid.

The players must provide numerical markers from 1 to 6 (we use 5mm dice).

26079.description:
Nomads established themselves in the oasis. The nomads desperately need wool and grain and offer commodities of the desert in exchange for them. Since the Cataners always have a few sheep and grain sheaves left over, the nomads send caravans out, in order to trade for the desired raw materials.
Through the course of the game, three caravan routes are formed with the caravan arrows. All settlements and cities on the caravan route count for one more victory point. Any road running alongside the caravan's route counts double for the trade route.

Published as a free give-away by Kosmos in 2006.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
26079.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Die große Karawane
boardgameaccessory: Die Siedler von Catan: Die große Karawane – Camel Meeples

26080.description:
You play an archaeologist in search of the kings chamber in a new pyramid that has been discovered. Using equipment you explore the hallways and chambers and get into one adventure after the other.

Contents:
5 adventure cards (both sides usable)
1 kings' chamber (both sides usable)
5 archaeologist in 5 different colors
1 warehouse
54 pyramid cards including:
36 equipment cards
18 special cards

Remake of Der Schatz des Pharaos with a few rules tweaks.
26080.name: Im Bann der Pyramide

26081.name: 54x12
26081.description: The original title of this cycling game is about a gear that can be selected on a bike. This French game appeared at the end of the '80s. The game contains 4 double sided big boards representing a Tour de France étappe on each one. It's played with 2 dice, 40 tactics cards, 32 mountain cards, 26 sprint cards and 30 rouleur cards. Every player gets a team of 3 plastic cyclists. In the beginning every player gets a number of tactical cards. Movement is decided by the dice and influenced by the cards. In the mountains the number rolled by the dice is divided by two. Cyclists can also encounter a flat tire (caused by rolling two 1's with the dice), if this happens to the team leader, he can be helped by a teammate if necessary. Winner is the player who scores best in the overall classification. There is also a mountain prize for the player who has the best climber in his team.

26082.name: Les 45 Tours de France
26082.description: This game, releases either late '50s or early '60s, is in a very original format. The game has a 45rpm record (album size) with the instructions on it (side A contains a flat stage, side B a mountain stage), the gameboard is the backside of the record sleeve. The board has a drawing of France on it, with a track on the outside. Movement of the pawns is decided by dice rolling.

26083.name: 6 in Einem
26083.description: This German vintage cycling game dates back to the period between 1910 and 1920! It has two boxes, on with an oval indoor cycling track on it, the smaller box contains 12 metal cyclist. Players can either form a team of several cyclists or play just with one cyclist. Movement is decided by rolling 2 wooden hand made dice. There are six kind of disciplines that can be raced on the track : Sechstagerennen (6 day cycling), Fliegerennen (flying start), Auscheidungsfahren, Puntkefahren (points race), Dauerrennen (durability) & Mannschaftsrennen (teamrace).

26084.name: Internationales 6 Tage Rennen
26084.description:
This cycling game appeared somewhere in the 1970's in East Germany. The game has very original mechanics as the movement of the plastic cyclists on the oval indoor track on the gameboard is not done by cards or by dice but by a speedometer, a device that looks a bit like a spinner. That only makes this game a collectors item.

Not to be confused with 6-Tage Rennen.

26085.name: Le Jeu des 7 Tours
26085.description: Le Jeu des 7 Tours is a cycling game containing a large board measuring 69x49cms., 14 pawns (unfortunately no plastic cyclists, just classic pawns here), two dice and 70 cards with questions about cycling. In the game it is possible to enter 7 different races. These are the Tours of France, Spain, USA, Japan, Benelux, Italy or Columbia. The tracks of these races are compiled out of a combination of flat stages, time trials and mountain stages. Movement is decided by rolling 2 dice, when someone rolls a 7 he has to draw a card and answer a question about cycling. The winner is he who wins the overall classifying of all races.

26086.description: This beautifully crafted vintage cycling game in a wooden box was produced in the USA at the end of the 19th century and truly a collectors item. There are 6 pawns, each representing a player. What makes it original is that movement is not decided by dice but by a spinning device (also ranging from 1 movement space to maximum 6). Every space on the board track also has text upon it, either giving the player luck or bad luck. Winner is the one who crosses the finish line first.
26086.name: Bicycle Race: A Game for the Wheelmen

26087.name: La Boucle des Fruits Rhône-Alpes
26087.description: Cycling game released in the early '90s by a company from Valence (France) named Samourai to promote fruit from the Rhône-Alpes region in France. Each player has a team of 3 cyclists. The 4 available teams are the Apricots (orange color), Pêches (pink), Pommes-Poires (green with yellow) and the Petits fruits (red colored cyclists). There also are a cyclist with a yellow and green jersey for the leader in the classification (yellow general, green points). The mechanics are rather simple (dice rolling).

26088.name: B.S.A. Cycle Race
26088.description: Small simple cycling game released by the Chad Valley Company released somewhere in the 1930's. Movement is decided by dice rolling, certain spaces have text in them that can cause bad luck. The game was released to promote the B.S.A. company who were well known for their motorbikes but they also had a range of bicycles in their catalog in those days.

26089.name: Dschingis Khan: Bewegung an der Großen Mauer
26089.description:
The great empires of China and Mongolia are divided by the Great Wall. Dzhingiz Khan, however, united the Mongolian tribes and is attempting to conquer China. In the resulting disorder warriors from both sides and farmers try to find safe places. Mongolian warriors want to be on the Mongolian side of the Great Wall, while Chinese warriors want to be on the Chinese side. Only farmers can be on both sides.

Dschingis Khan – Bewegung an der Großen Mauer is an abstract strategy game with a big dose of luck. Player place markers with warriors, farmers, the plague or a cure on spaces on the board. Whoever placed the top marker controls the pile. Points are awarded for warriors on the right side of the wall and (less) for farmers. However, the Wall can 'move': new walls can be built and parts of the old wall can be removed.

26090.name: Butagaz
26090.description: Butagaz (subtitled 'Le Tour de France du premier butane français) was released in France in 1934 to promote the use of gas. The gameboard measures 37x28cms (A3 format). Movement of the pawns is decided by a die. As a curiosity, the cyclist who rejoins a Butagaz truck on a square advances two squares. The gameboard has a Tour de France map on it with the two Butagaz factories (in Paillac and Rouen) also mentioned on it. Winner is the player who's pawn reaches Paris first.

26091.description: This game had several releases. It was originally released by Spika, a game publisher from Karl-Marx-Stadt (now Chemnitz) in East Germany (DDR). Bunte Trikots is a cycling game with a 47x34cm. board with an indoor oval cycling track (with 100 spaces) on it. The original version from 1959 had a blue background, the 1964 version a grey background. In the '60s a Belgian version (also with a blue background) was released in both French and Dutch language. There are 6 plastic cyclists (one for each player) that move after rolling a die. There are different rules for in total 5 different disciplines that can be raced on the track. Vintage game for collectors and cycling lovers.
26091.name: Bunte Trikots, Blitzende Räder

26092.name: Corse Ciclistiche
26092.description: This Italian cycling game has a modular board, meaning that you can compile your own track by combining road tiles. There are also traffic signs that can influence the game. The mechanics are dice controlled. There are 4 different levels in this game. As often in racing games the winner is the one who covers the distance first.

26093.description:
The goal of the game is to eat food (as much as possible): spaghetti, hamburger and pizza are what koala like most.

The koala are going to do anything to eat food. Koala is perhaps the first game where the sitting places of the players is very important forcing players to change their plans during the game.

Koala also has a team variant which makes the game more strategic. It also makes it longer to play.
26093.name: Koala

26094.name: Maillot Arc-en-Ciel
26094.description: This beautiful self made game by Anki Toner from Barcelona contains 42 cyclists (in 6 colors); 2 dice, a cyclist in rainbow colors, 25 chance cards, 10 small and 10 big chits. The components of the game are in a solid wooden box. The gameboard (51x51cm) has a track on it that looks quite original. Movement is decided by dice rolling and the chance cards.

26095.name: La Serpiente Multicolor
26095.description:
This hard to find Spanish cycling game has cut-up cardboards who figure as the cyclists, there also are cardboard-signs. The game has a board with a track divided in different sections. Players also can alter the outcome of the race by playing tactical cards.

Free download from http://www.cyclingboardgames.net

26096.description:
M6 Turbo cup is a strategic simulation of a car race. T win the game U also have to obtain the correct licenses and hire staff (mechanics). Obtaining a license is done by getting hidden objectives during the race.

Components of the game: 1 board, 1 bloc note, 4 race cars, 4 team managers, 4 mechanic teams, 20 int. race licenses, 20 car control cards, condition cards, luck cards, safety cards and money.
26096.name: M6 Turbo Cup

26097.name: Snarps
26097.description: Snarps are monsters who intend to scare people out of their house. As a player you control such a monster and try to get other players out of the house. This game was nominated for a Pion d'Or by the Jeux & Strategie magazine in 1991.

26098.name: Captain Video: An Exciting Space Game
26098.description: Based on a TV Show that ran from 1949-1957, this is a game of space exploration in which players move their four markers through the solar system. Movement is controlled by a spinner that is part of a fold-out cockpit which helps deepen the Captain Video theme.

26099.name: Space Game
26099.description:
This is a space exploration game for kids. Players race through space using one of five metal spaceship playing pieces collecting treasure on the planets and space stations located on the board. Players have the option of selecting one of two numbers after spinning for their turn.

An Australian version was produced by John Sands (Sydney) under licence from Parker Brothers. The concept of the game is the same but considerable differences in graphics can be seen on the board, spinner and box. The US version shows the Americas visible from earth while the Australian version shows Australia and south-east Asia. The spaceship playing pieces are the same as the US game although the instructions suggest only 4 players instead of 5 in the US version. As players advance around the board they collect (or lose) gold nuggets which are simply small stones painted gold. This also seems to differ from the collecting pieces in the US version.

26100.name: Strandburg
26100.description:
'Strandburg' (sandcastle) was produced in Austria in 1979. It is part of the first wave of cooperative games that hit europe(an kids) in the late seventies and arguably among the most intense experiences, because it features real experiences most kids have.

The goal of the game is to finish a sandcastle before it is destroyed by the rising tide. As with most of these games directed at players around the age of 5, decisions do not change the outcome of the game too much, it comes down to the luck of the dice.
Depending on the colours you roll on the 2 dice, you either add waves, parts of the sandcastle or help other players out. The feeling of being 'in this together' is very present.

Distribution in the Benelux was done by Jumbo, the game appeared there under the same name.

26101.name: Worst Case Scenario: The Game of Surviving Life
26101.description:
From The University Games Website:

"The newest addition to our line of Worst Case Scenario games takes players from birth to death through life's stages - youth, college, career, family - with 600 thought-provoking, fun-filled questions. With game pieces that move across the board with removable body-parts, the challenge is to get through the game with all parts intact while gathering rewards along the way. The player who accumulates the most gold pieces while losing the least body-parts is the winner."

26102.name: Borodino 1812
26102.description:
A new concept of the military history publications. A book of history, a model, and if you wish, a wargame.

The works are visual books. Their task is to reach those familiar with military history and make that the non-familiar become interested, by means of this glaring and easy system of reproducing a battle. By mounting a model, in a simple manner, you will be able to simulate the historical movements of the units or ships, using a co-ordinate system. For that, you will count on the assistance of the Historical Handbook and the Battle Guide. Included are also rules for play alternate "what if?"

The box includes:
-Historical notes of the battle
-84x60cm board
-Laminated figures
-Deploy charts
-2 dice
...

For more information, check: www.deltaediciones.com

boardgamehonor: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
26103.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Reiner Knizia, himself a mathematician, has developed a new game in the “Clevermacher” series that will engage even notorious mathphobes: Primo Calculino. The ‘hero’ in this lovingly-produced game is the seller Johann, who has lots of tasty things for sale. Ready for the big sales, Johann, represented in the game as a seven cm high wooden figure, has not only the appropriate shopping tiles but also shopping bags in different sizes. And unfortunately, not everything fits into them! Little math artists will have to figure out more than just adding one plus one to make sure that only those things that belong land in the bags. The rest just wouldn’t fit…

Primo Calculino doesn’t just add enjoyment, it also subtracts and multiplies it. And so, while playing, mathematical abilities as well as memory and concentration are built. The nice thing is that nobody outside of adults will notice…

Here is a description of the game from Selecta Spielzeug:

A mathematical learning game with many variations.

You can put so many tasty things into your bag, but sometimes, they don´t all fit! This game will teach little mathematical wizards more than just adding up one and one.

Contents:
1 figure, 36 task cards, 40 food cards (2½ x 2½ in.), instructions
26103.name: Primo Calculino

26105.description:
The second collection of extra courses for TurfMaster. This expansion includes one additional board with two race courses: Frankfurt and Leipzig.

Expands:

TurfMaster
26105.name: TurfMaster Course Collection 2

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
26106.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Gezanke auf der Planke is a three-dimensional family game by Dominique Handel that is already available. Pirates are afraid of water but today is bath day and they all have to go into the ocean. But nobody wants to. Because for pirates, the rules is: he who washes and saves, loses. Nobody wants to go into the water, and so there's a lot of pushing and shoving on the plank. Each tries to stay as far back on the plank as possible and push the others overboard. Finally, a large shark was also spotted happily circling the ship in anticipation.

16 pirates in four colors stand in rows and columns on the plank. Each player draws a counter out a bag that secretly indicates which his color is. Now each player tries to move the pirates such that at least one pirate of his color is left on board at the end of the game. Players may move all pirates of any color. On a player's turn, he first turns the wind rose. It chooses the first move - if two pirates are exchanged, for example, or move one pirate to the head, the end of the line, or one space forwards, or no action at all. Secondly, a full row of pirates is always pushed on space forwards. So, over the course of the game, pirates fall off the plank - and into the mouth of the waiting shark!
26106.name: Gezanke auf der Planke!

26108.name: Jona und der große Fisch
26108.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Jona und der grosse Fisch (Jonah and the Big Fish) is by Uli Geissler and is a game about the story of Jonah. Jonah was given the assignment to travel to Nineveh. There, he is to ensure that the people make up for their mistakes. A difficult assignment for Jonah, who'd love to try and avoid it. In the game, the goal is to bring Jonah to Nineveh with the help of big fish, to save him and to prevent him from fleeing to Tarsis so that God's will can be carried out. All game figures are made of wood.

26109.name: Crossroad
26109.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Crossroad is a card game originally developed for those involved in emergency planning, but is now also being widely released in Japan. The game is supposed to teach what can happen to the Japanese in the event of a catastrophic earthquake as well as what to do in such an event.

The game is for 5 to 7 players, and the number of players should be uneven if possible. At the start of the game, each player has the same number of 10 episode cards in hand. He also has a Yes card and a No card.

One of the players begins and reads the text from one of this episode cards. Then, the players try to guess how the majority of the players would act in the situation described. They choose either their Yes or No card, laying it face-down on the table in front of themselves.

Each player that chose the majority answer gets a point. These are represented by blue Zabutons (traditional Japanese pillows). The pillows have a symbolic meaning for many Japanese. Traditionally, Japanese comedians sit on blue zabutons during their performance, and they are sometimes given to others whose opinions are given the utmost respect.

But here Crossroad doesn't end - because it is highly honored when a player is alone in his opinion and manages to defend his position well. Here, a golden zabuton is awarded...

Toshiko Kikkawa is an organizational psychologist and professor at Keio University in Tokyo Katsuya Yamori is a social psychologist and professor at Kyoto University Tsuyoshi Ajiro is a freelance game designer

boardgamehonor: 2006 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee
26110.name: Waimiri
26110.description:
Description of game from Spielbox:

Waimiri is a game about the aluminum trade in Brazil and was nominated for the Germaning Learning Prize 2006. The game concept: In the Brazilian rainforest, bauxite was found in the ancestral home of the Waimiri-Atroari (called the Waimiri in the game) - bauxite being the main aluminum ore. An international conglomerate has obtained a license from the Brazilian government to mine the ore. In this game, the Brazilian government, the mining company and the Waimiri negotiate the particulars and determine the consequences. Through construction of roads, factories and power plants the Waimiri lose their homeland.

Waimiri is a communications game for 3 groups, each of 3-10 players 14 and up, and is especially well suited for high schoolers from grades 9 to 12 learning about industry and the environment.

26111.name: Sport ist Mord
26111.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

This game will help you, by playing as much sports as possible, to get really fit. But careful! Sports are dangerous! Those who train too hard and too much will easily get hurt, possibly even die. This game will show you just how shockingly dangerous sports can be. Since it's so dangerous, the game doesn't demand any sporting activity from the players at all.

The game includes 110 cards, 60 dice and various doping pills.

26112.name: Metropolen
26112.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Metropolen (Metropolises) is also by Jorg Miethe. Here, the goal is to place the location of various metropolises on a blank map. The closer your X comes to the correct location, the more points you get.

The game was invented during a car ride from Stuttgart to Leipzig. There was a lot of traffic and therefore lots of traffic jams mentioned on the news. The inventor pictured a map of Germany during these announcements and tried to arrange the towns mentioned. From this situation arose the first prototype "Highway Guessing". This very quickly turned into the playable "Metropolen".

The game can be used by school classes as a geography learning game (for example in two groups playing against each other) or as an educational game for traveling groups or other parties. The game was tested in a casual group and was a real conversation starter ("I know where that is, I had the most unbelievable experience there...").

26113.name: Gebrauchtwagen Händler
26113.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Used Car Dealer - Trash or Treasure is a card game by Jorg Miethe. Buy the best used cars from the other players and create the best car collection of all. But each used car has its secrets. Perhaps there's a treasure chest in the trunk or possibly hidden accident damage. Unfortunately, you can't trust anyone in this game. In the next round, it's your chance to sell and you can then try and foist the cursed cars on someone else.

The game is based on the "Lemon Game" from business theory. The lemon game is often used to explain credit notes in the banking industry. There are two important things that a lemon game needs. One player has more information than the other and there is a greater supply than demand. The theory says that in such situations, if a player does everything right, he's making the wrong choice! BTW, the name of the game comes from 'Lemon' being slang for a car you'd rather not buy.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee
2007 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2008 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
26114.description:
Description of the game from Adam Spielt:

The players are diving for sunken treasure! Each dive, they must decide anew how much of a risk to take and either dive deeper or take a treasure closer to the surface. But be careful - watch out for the sea monsters! Not all of them are friendly. Excitement guaranteed! The player who could gather the most valuable treasures by the end of the game is the winner! An exciting mechanic, simple rules and a tricky lighting technology.
26114.name: Secrets of the Sea
boardgamepodcastepisode: Session Impressions: Secrets of the Sea

26116.name: Schäfchen zählen
26116.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Sheepworld - Schafchen zahlen (Sheepworld - counting sheep) is a fast-paced card game in which concentration, reactions and a sharp eye are needed! Black, white and red sheep are playing happily on the cards, but how many exactly? Count the sheep and quickly grab the right number card! The game was invented by Arno Steinwender and Andrea Steinhauser.

26117.description:
Description of the game from Ravensburger (Translated by W. Eric Martin):

Ship ahoy with the numbers from 1-20

Where does the banana box go? Is this the place? At the harbor, the sailors load valuable freight in their ships. Each ship is distinctively large and must be loaded in the best way possible. Which ships fill up first and can begin the adventure on the high seas? The counting captain offers numerous exercises for the playful training of addition and subtraction in the number range from 1-20. He supports number understanding and promotes logical thinking. The option of playing alone lets children play and learn independently.

Contents

12 ships
6 warehouses
75 ware boxes
1 wood die
1 set of game instructions
26117.name: Rechen-Kapitän

boardgamehonor: 2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
26118.description:
Description of the game from Ravensburger (Translated by W. Eric Martin):

The action game with lots of navigation, working cannons, and a gigantic cloth game mat! Are you ready to take to the high seas as courageous pirates fighting against one another? Then hoist the sails, raise the anchors, and take off to adventure! Who will best steer his ship with skill over the seas? Who will aim, shoot and score with flair? And who at the end will with a little luck bring the most valuable treasures back to the harbor? In this game, you can show who's the real king of the sea.

Contents

1 gameboard (1m x 1.6m)
2 pirate ships (each with 1 figurehead, 1 steering wheel, 1 front mast with sail and mast basket, 1 main mast with 2 sails, 1 pirate flag, 1 lantern, and 1 rear trapdoor)
3 cannons
3 cannonballs (= arrows)
4 treasure trunks
1 tower with 1 tower flag and 2 doors
1 dial with spinner
2 provision sacks
2 rum barrels
18 record cards
10 order cards
6 gold coins (3 ea. of sea serpents and sharks)
1 construction instructions
1 game instructions
26118.name: Pirates on the High Seas

26119.name: Wiener Sammelsurium
26119.description:
Description of the game from the Spielbox:

Wiener Sammelsurium is a humorous quiz game by Harald Havas and Ronald Hofstatter. Have you ever wanted to know how many kilograms of horse manure are dropped daily on the streets of Vienna, or how many pieces of mail are sent daily to the Alterlaa buildings, or how many children Maria Theresia had? Answers to these and many more everyday and historical questions about Vienna are offered by this board game. Lost of questions and answers to the interesting and strange, curious and macabre about Vienna were turned into a humorous board game by the authors.

26120.name: Resi und Rudi Ringel
26120.description:
Description of the game from the Spielbox:

Resi and Rudi Ringel, the two young caterpillars, were brought to life by Brigitte Pokornik. Resi and Rudi want to know which of them is faster! Ready, set, go: The race over stick and stone is on. On a player's turn, he rolls the die. The end of the caterpillar is always placed ahead of the head, so long as the color collar is ahead as well. Then, the caterpillar's head is moved to that color. If a player rolls a color that the head is already on, then he may put a barrier up in front of the other caterpillar. That player must now navigate past the barrier. As soon as a caterpillar touches the goal flag, the game is over.

26121.name: Palm Beach Island Resort
26121.description:
Description of the game from Spielbox:

Palm Beach Island Resort is described as a tactical game. By placing needed infrastructure onto the spaces of the Island, a tourist resort is created that will be visited by guests from around the world. The goal of the game is to build Bungalows and encourage the tourists to part with their money; that is, make a tidy profit. Each player acts as a travel agent trying to fill his bungalows up.

26122.name: Monopoly: Spanish
26122.description: The name of the game speaks for itself. In this Spanish Version you'll be able to tour the streets of Madrid buying them with your no longer existent "pesetas", building houses and hotels from Lavapiés until the Paseo del Prado.

26123.name: Definition: Cronicas Marcianas
26123.description:
"Definition" is a commercial version of the traditional family game of "Dictionary". Here, the players start with their rockets in Earth and have to reach Mars by earning votes for their definitions of weird words and points for guessing what the true definition of those words is.

In each turn a referee player, who changes after the end of the turn, draws a card in which different eccentric words are specified. The rest of the players write down a definition for the word secretly on a piece of paper. Then, the referee reads aloud all definitions and players have to vote which one they think is true (they cannot vote their own definition). According to the number of votes received for their definition or if they where able to find the true definition, the players can move their rockets towards Mars. Also, the dice can determine if the players ought to write a funnier definition instead of trying to find the true one, or if instead of a word it's a famous star that they have to define, or if the definition is given to them instead of the word and they have to find this last one.
The first player in Mars wins the game.

26124.description:
For Faerie Tales
