In this strategy and fantasy board game, you take control of one of the kingdoms after dragons awake. The game begins with tiles placed face down to build the territory. Players explore the territory while fighting enemy troops with knights, soldiers, a Pegasus, and captured dragons. War is only one strategy to play -- players can also try to take the princess to the enemy castle and force her marriage to the local prince.

For Draco Mundis
The players have the responsibility of a team of various adventurers trying to gain victory points by exploring the jungle. All players start with exactly the same team.

First they must lay down their pawns (characters, terrains) and then, in turn, realize two actions, like move, fight, or explore.

In order to gain victory points, they can kill their opponents or manage to place some of their characters in strategic points on the map.

Each pawn has its own constraints, e.g. all cannot move in every direction, or have the same movement points and fight points. Some have special abilities.
26124.name: Faerie Tales

26125.name: The Reel to Reel Picture Show James Bond 007 Movie Trivia Game
boardgamepublisher: The Reel to Reel Picture Show Ltd.
26125.description:
An expansion for the Reel to Reel Picture show game, this game could be played on its own with home rules.

The questions fall into four categories which are color coded

Yellow covers the Bond Basics, questions about Bond Girls, Villains and the props. These questions are usually the easiest of the four categories.

Pink covers the films of the Connery and Lazenby era.

Blue covers the Moore, Dalton and Pierce Brosnan films. At the time of this game being made, only Goldeneye had been made for Brosnan.

Silver covers Extras and other background characters, credits, the various music of the films and catchphrases and quotes. This category can be either very easy or quite obscure.

26126.description:
A dice-and-chart simulation of golf. From the publisher's we site:

Tee Time Golf is a shot-by-shot golf simulation that allows you to coach the sport's greatest historical golfers, as well as today's best, over 18 holes on the world's premier golf courses. Professionals and some amateurs are available for purchase and they are rated using the same criteria. Golfers from the U.S., European, and Japanese professional tours are represented.
26126.name: Tee Time Golf

26127.name: Ten Events Decathlon Board Game
26127.description: Ten Events is a simulation of the men's decathlon competition and allows you to coach the event's all-time greats in a tabletop simulation. Each athlete is rated for each of the decathlon's 10 events plus likelihood of injury. Dice and charts are used to generate results for each event. The game includes dozens of athletes including famous Olympians, athletes from the pre-Olympic era, and famous athletes from other events.

26128.name: Final Lap Auto Racing Board Game
26128.description: Final Lap Auto Racing is a dice-and-chart simulation of auto racing. The game is purchasable with sets of drivers from recent seasons or all-time greats from Formula 1, NASCAR, and Indy racing. Ratings for numerous tracks are included with the game. Drivers are rated for their ability to claim pole position, finish races, finish on the lead lap, win races, and race finish if not the winner.

26129.description:
Heavy Gear Blitz! is the latest (2006) Heavy Gear miniatures game from Dream Pod 9. A much more streamlined version of the original tactical game but in a very new design. Still holding true to the Silhouette game system old players should find the game very familiar and new players should find it fast and easy to learn. Its eliminates the hex based maps and uses a to-scale terrain system familiar to most miniature games.

The rulebook contains an introduction to the world of Terra Nova, the revised and streamlined rules, basic field guides for the forces on Terra Nova, a random scenario generator, 28 data cards covering all the standard vehicles in the field guides, as well as an assortment of counters for tracking the battle status of your army.
26129.name: Heavy Gear Blitz!

26130.description: American game releases at Essen '95. The components of the game consists of wooden pieces with 6 corners. It's an educational game to learn about fractions.
26130.name: Action Fractions

26131.name: Affen Angeln
26131.description: Each player controls an ape, goal is to swing from limb to limb (movement is done over tiles).

26132.description:
The game tries to recreate the Midgard role playing feeling in a boardgame. It addresses former Midgard RPG players, who don't find the time for role playing anymore, as well as fans of fantasy boardgames. As the complexity level is rather high and the game offers multiple options for players, Midgard is rather successful in achieving it's goal. The difficulty is still light to medium, despite dozens of cards that influence the game and the characters.

The game is based on tiles (major cities of Midgard) players move across, collecting rare items and fulfilling adventures. Often this ends in the local city jail or in clashes with monsters. Additional threats like terror cards or riots pop up in cities during the game.

Tests are made with a 20-sided die and the mechanics are just the same as in the Midgard RPG. Movement and actions are controlled by action cards from a four-card-hand which allows tactical gaming. Each action card has different abilities and some may even interrupt another player's turn.

Players may form groups for the duration of a game turn to help each other solve adventures or make difficult tests. Sticking together earns each player of a group experience points and treasure cards. As only one player can finally win the game, forming groups is a two-edged sword as it helps your opponents too. The goal of the game is to get 3 treasure rewards, rise to character level 3 and find 2 artifacts first. If you deliver the treasures and artifacts to the correct city you have won the game.

Included are pre-generated characters like Sorcerer or Warrior but players will be able to create their own characters in the final release version.

This information is derived from the website of Phantastische-Spielewelten.

http://www.phantastische-spielewelten.de
26132.name: Midgard: Das Brettspiel

26134.description:
In this game, players fight Dragons with swords and nets.
The 80 numbered playing cards show one of the following:

1 sword
1 net
2 swords
2 nets
1 sword & 1 net

Every dragon card shows 1-5 swords and 0-3 nets.

One dragon is revealed from the dragon pile. All players choose one of the five playing cards in their hand and play them simultaneously. Starting with the lowest number on the played cards the number of swords are counted. The player who played the sword that equals the number of swords on the dragon has "tamed" the dragon. If the dragon card shows any number of nets the remaining cards played by the players are checked for any nets. If the number of nets equals the number of nets on the dragon card the player who played the corresponding net cards catches the dragon. If the number of nets played is lower than the one on the dragon the dragon "tamer" wins the dragon card.

The players draw cards from the draw pile and the next dragon card is revealed.
26134.name: Die Drachenbändiger von Zavandor

26135.description:
Rules

An abstract game played on a hexagonal board of 61 fields.


9 . . . . .
8 . . . . . .
7 . . . . . . .
6 . . . . . . . .
5 . . . . . . . . .
4 . . . . . . . . i
3 . . . . . . . h
2 . . . . . . g
1 . . . . . f
a b c d e


Reminiscent of Go, but the rules are essentially:

Gameplay alternates between the two players. A player's turn consists on either


setting an off-board stone on an empty field on board, or
sliding an on-board stone onto an adjacent empty field.


You cannot pass. If each player is performing three slides in a row (meaning six consecutive plies or game actions being slides in total) then the game ends immediately as a draw.

You win as soon as any of the opponent's stones is surrounded on all liberties. Surrounding this stone is valid by any combination of own stones, opponent's stones, and even the board edges.


9 . . . . .
8 . . . . . .
7 . . . . . . .
6 . . . . . . . .
5 . . . O O X . . .
4 . . O . O X . . i
3 . . . X X . . h
2 . . . . . . g
1 . . . . . f
a b c d e


The diagram shows a situation where setting the next stone onto field d4 would result in an immediate win of player X since stone on e4 would completely be surrounded. It does not matter if the surrounding stones are stones of player X or player O.

If one of your own pieces is surrounded on your turn, you lose even if an opponent's stone is surrounded at the same time. Thus here the opponent will win the game in that case.

Assumed it is player X's turn: In the diagram shown above setting stone X on field d4 is a win for player X since stone O on e4 gets completely surrounded.

Assumed it is player O's turn: In the diagram shown above setting stone O on field d4 is a win for player X, too, since stone O on e4 gets completely surrounded.

Assumed it is player O's turn: Setting a stone onto field c3 will continue the game. Player X cannot win any longer by setting his stone onto d4 since then he would lose immediately since this newly set stone is completely surrounded then. He is loosing even if at the same time stone O on e4 gets surrounded at the same time.


9 . . . . .
8 . . . . . .
7 . . . . . . .
6 . . . . . . . .
5 . . . O O X . . .
4 . . O . O X . . i
3 . . O X X . . h
2 . . . . . . g
1 . . . . . f
a b c d e


Mind that you can slide one of your stones on your turn as well. It is not just setting the own stones.


9 . . . . .
8 . . . . . .
7 . . . . . . .
6 . . . . . . . .
5 . . . . . . . . .
4 . . . . . . . . i
3 . X O . . . . h
2 O X O . . . g
1 . O . . . f
a b c d e


Note that in the diagram above stone X on field b2 is perfectly safe. Neither player can set onto field a1 without loosing the game since the stone set onto a1 would be completely and directly surrounded. Result would be a own loss of the game.


References


Original rules text: http://www.stephen.com/sue/sue_man.txt
Note that Stephen Linhart's page uses a different game notation

About the game: http://www.stephen.com/sue/sueabout.html
Java version of the game Susan: http://sourceforge.net/projects/susan/
Note: the Lawa Susan does not seem to include the rule on draw situations on six consecutive set of stones

Play by email server: http://gamerz.net/pbmserv/susan.html
There is a computer version available for the Macintosh as well: http://www.stephen.com/sue/suemac.html
26135.name: Susan

26136.description:
Purple Dragon is a mini-expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The character comes in blue and orange colors.

For 2 AP's (plus a song) the Purple Dragon (stats: 2/6) can invoke an acid rain to destroy all portcullis in a room. The Dragon is worth 2 VP when destroyed.

The expansion was given out at the 2006 Essen fair.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
26136.name: Dungeon Twister: Purple Dragon

26137.name: Deal or No Deal: Electronic Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: Deal or No Deal
26137.description: Compete against the bank or up to three other players in a battle to win big in this electronic home version of the international hit television show. The rules are simple. Each player selects a briefcase. As each round progresses, players may keep their original briefcase or make a “Deal” with the bank to accept a cash offer in exchange for whatever dollar amount is in their selected briefcase. The rotating electronic gameboard keeps track of all players' choices and their subsequent “Deals”…or “No Deals,” which are kept secret until the end of the game. For ages 8 and up.

26138.description:
With the purchase of the collector's box comes membership into the exclusive Dungeon Twister Club. The club offers additional information, puzzles, tournament invitations, specials, etc. Membership is free and limited to 1000 members.

The collector's box is limited to 1000 copies!
26138.name: Dungeon Twister Collectors Box

26139.name: Hungry Hound
26139.description: This is a battery operated kids game that has a motorized hound dog in the middle of the game which spins around, opening and closing it's mouth as players try to flip small bone-shaped chips from small spring-loaded paws into it's mouth. It is very similar, if not identical, in game-play to "Mr. Mouth"

26140.name: Pop-Cheks
26140.description:
From the box: "Pop-Cheks is a new and exciting way of playing checkers, using the "Pop-o-matic""

A six-sided die inside of the pop-o-matic bubble tells which color gets to go next. In this fashion, players may lose their turn or get multiple turns in a row.

26141.name: Tavern
26141.description:
"Dwarfs, elves, orcs and other strange beings visit your tavern. Try to serve them enough drinks, but don't let it get out of hand!"
Each player is the owner of a tavern. They try to attract customers with musician cards. They collect points by serving their guests drinks and keeping them in their tavern as long as they can (for example, if there are many dwarfs in your tavern, all the elves will go out). The player who has collected most points after 2 rounds (day and night) is the winner of the game.

26142.description: This expansion for Maestro Leonardo (Leonardo da Vinci) was distributed in Essen 2006 to the buyers of Maestro Leonardo and adds one more area to the city: the market. There the players have a chance to exchange hand cards with the cards that are already in the market. The exchanged cards remain in the market for future exchanges.
26142.name: Maestro Leonardo: Codex Leonardi – II

26143.name: Kings and Queens
26143.description:
A game of skill featuring the lineage of the Kings and Queens of the UK.

A game for 2 players where players maneuver their pieces on a grid attempting to get the value of their 6 pieces to equal 30. Each King and Queen has a value ranging from 1 to 8 based on their recognized titles: Henry the 8th is 8 points, Edward the 2nd is 2 points and so on.

Each player moves pieces orthogonally or diagonally and has to move as far as they can before stopping. The game ends when a player reaches 30 points.

26144.description:
This is an expansion given to the buyers of Fredericus in Essen 2006.
Now you can, instead of betting on a keep, bet on a capture of any other player. If that player captures two creatures you win 2 goal cards.
26144.name: Fredericus: Sigillum Magnum

26145.description:
This is one expansion given to the buyers of Palatinus in Essen 2006.
It replaces one random territory tile from the base game.
26145.name: Palatinus: Insula Tiberina

26146.name: Musketier: Im Auftrag der Königin
26146.description: Paris in 1625. The players take over the role of the musketeers Athos, Porthos, Aramis and D'Artagnan trying to travel from Paris to Calais. During the travel the musketeers are attacked by the troops of cardinal Richelieu. Each round one of the musketeers must sacrifice in order to fulfill their quest. The one surviving is D'Artagnan the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
26147.description:
Description from 2F-Spiele:

What do you do if you are supposed to quickly draw the left side of Queen Elizabeth II? You draw half a crown, a dress ... but already everybody but you has shouted stop and you only just started to draw the Queen's face. And you still wanted to draw Buckingham Palace in the left corner ... Now it's up to your left neighbor to save you both. Unfortunately, you hear her mourning once she reads whom she's supposed to draw. But maybe some good idea will strike her?

Idea of the game:
4 and more players try simultaneously to recognizably draw one side of a person chosen before. If you are ready, you shout "Stop!". The slowest player must not finish. Fold the sheet, and let your left neighbor complete the right side of the person chosen - without looking at the left side.
Monstermaler is the perfect game for the party, for warming up or cooling down and for people who don't like games. By the way, it's rather a disadvantage to know how to draw when playing Monstermaler.

Components:
1 A6-pad of 120 sheets, German rules are printed on the inner side of the cover. Add a pen and if needed a shade for every player.

Separate French (Monstre-moi un dessin) and English (Split Personality) versions of this game are available from Canada's KiKi Gagne?.

While the list of people on the back of each sheet is focused on Canadians, it is more accessible to those in the United States than that from the German edition.

Re-implemented by:


Tadaaam!
26147.name: Monstermaler

26148.name: Affentennis
26148.description:
Affentennis (Monkey Tennis) is a dexterity game with a good strategic design. The tennis court is overlaid with a hex grid, and players use a rubber-band mechanism to hit the ball. The Monkeys are used only to note the location of the player on the court -- they could have just been cubes, but look much better this way. The Monkeys, by the way, are from south German television commercials.

The game includes options you might not expect from the name or from an unknown small publisher. Each player has a limited amount of movement when hitting or returning a shot, and then can "borrow" from their next move but this puts them under pressure and thus limits their ability to shoot most effectively. Other clever options include the ability to serve and volley using a clever wooden block idea, the ability to lob over a volley using a ramp, and the ability to smash a volley.

26149.name: Bolide Tracks #1: Roma, Italian GP, and O Copo, Brazilian GP
26149.description:
Two new tracks for the Bolide race game.

Roma (Italy) - Ancient Fashions
O Copo (Brazil) - Champions' Curves




Expands:

Bolide

26150.name: Caillou Gigantik Game
26150.description:
A children's game for ages 3+ based on the animated television show Caillou. The object of the game is to pick up all your toys and return them to your toy box. The first player to pick up all their toys and return to their room is the winner.

The game is distinguished by the Gigantik play mat board which is layed out on a giant plastic mat to be played on the floor rather than a regular style board.

26151.name: Square Routes
26151.description:
Classic abstract strategy game. Make the colors work for you. Out-think your opponent. A good game of strategy and counter-strategy.

Redeveloped into


Kamisado (adds continued play with promotion and varied board reset)

26152.name: Das Eisenbahnspiel
26152.description: Travel around Germany by train in this hard to find game. "Board" is a rolled up inside a triangular tube. Players try to visit as many German cities as possible using specific rules and some dice rolling.

26153.name: Hit
26153.description: Japanese mob-themed card game. Players try to make the most successful "hits" without getting caught.

26154.description:
(from the Firefight Games website)

Nawana was a turning point battle. It was here, a Bolivian Army led by German General Kundt, armed with new weapons (tanks, flame-throwers, fighter-bombers) assaulted the Paraguayan defenses not from Paraguay's capitol. Kundt had been led to believe the defenses were weak, that the tanks would break through and that once Nanawa fell, the road would be open to Paraguay’s capital. This was in fact true, however, that was the only thing which was true. The Paraguayan forces had been issued special antitank ammo and built well defended trenches with mines. Their lines were not weak and numerically almost as strong as the Bolivian! The Paraguayans had proved themselves many times during this war as a very dangerous foe even when outnumbered. After three days of fighting and a combined body count of over 4000 men with little real gain, the Bolivians halted.

Components:
1 11x17 inch map
280 counters,
Player aids

Scale:
Company-level
1 hex=250 yards
1 turn=8 hours
26154.name: Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933

26155.name: Roundabout Five
26155.description:
From the media kit:
In Roundabout Five, players compete as individuals on teams that randomly change their composition and size on every turn (Dynamic Teams). On regular game cards, teams encounter trivia, odd comparisons (Which happened first? The United States attacks Libya or the Culture Club releases Do You Really Want to Hurt Me) , riddles, jokes, math and grammar problems. Second Option cards introduce elements such as debate (Would Daffy or Donald Duck last longer on the cartoon version of Survivor?), charades and personal trivia (Was I born before or after Woodstock?) to the game, creating a whole new level of fun. R5 can be played by 3 or more adult players for a total point objective, select number of turns or within any given time constraint.

Home Page: http://www.roundaboutfive.com

26156.description:
In this re-themed edition of Ausgerechnet Buxtehude, we are now trying to learn the geographical locations of cities and sights all over Europe.

Players place cards on the table according to their relative location. Other players may doubt the accuracy of the placement you made. Should the accusations turn out to be true, you would have to give out a scoring marker. The player with the most scoring markers in the end wins.

The game includes 200 location cards with longitude, latitude, and other information on the locations.

Re-implements:


Ausgerechnet Buxtehude
26156.name: Ausgerechnet Uppsala

26157.name: Top oder Flop
26157.description:
Five movies are being produced, and players each have a more or less high investment in them. Players with high investment play cards to increase the movie's success, while your opponents may play the same cards to ensure its failure.

Cards can influence one or two movies, or they can cause other cards to be moved from the "Top" side to the "Flop" side or vice-versa.

The player who has the most investment in the most successful movies is the winner.

26158.name: Hiwataka
26158.description:
For the first time, Little Wolf and his friends are allowed to get the necessary food for their families. They have beautifully made tomahawks and earthenware jugs, leather clothes and feather headdresses on board their canoes to exchange for pumpkins, herbs, maize, and fish. It's an exciting adventure because the river is treacherous and it is not always immediately possible to steer to the right market stand.

A quality wooden game from Beleduc.

Ages 4 and up.

26159.name: Bengali
26159.description: The elephant keepers are very busy because the cheeky elephants are always running away and hiding in the jungle. So, they have decided now to build a separate enclosure for each elephant to put an end to the tiresome searching.

26160.name: Daisy Racy
26160.description: The lambs frolic and romp on the meadow. The mother sheep have eaten almost everything in the meadow so they must make their way together with their lamb over to another grazing spot. To ensure that none of them gets lost, the little lambs must always stay close to their mothers. To encourage them not to forget in their exuberance, they are given daisies as rewards if they follow their mothers instead of running on ahead.

26161.name: Quakies
26161.description:
Beautiful water lilies bloom on the pond and not only the ducks come to marvel at them. The cheeky frogs also love the water lilies and each frog tries to get hold of as many as possible before the large dragonfly comes and snatches the remaining blossoms.

Ages 4 and up.

26162.description:
From the website:

Stake your claim! Get the best patch of land in these gold-filled hills. Roll the dice to claim an area as your own. Steal claims from other players, or double your claim and make an area permanently yours. Keep rolling as long as you want, claiming more land on each roll. But watch out: if you make a bad roll, you lose everything you claimed this turn. Build the biggest system of mines and win it all!

How to Play

Players will claim spaces on the board by rolling three dice. You may keep rolling and claiming more spaces, or you may stop at any time. When you stop, you replace all the white "Squatter" markers with markers of your own color. If you keep rolling, you risk losing what you gained this turn. If you roll a combination of numbers that you cannot use, you bust and all the spaces that you claimed this turn are lost. When the game ends, the player with the largest connected group of spaces wins.
26162.name: Claim It!

26163.name: The Christmas Game
26163.description:
Info from the publisher, translated into English:

2-4 players take the role of Santa Claus and have therefore an important task: all gifts have to be delivered in a timely manner before Christmas. But Knecht Ruprecht tries everything to prevent this.
An included CD should create a lighthearted Christmas - atmosphere.

26164.name: Pajonk
26164.description:
To board shows a spiral with spots for the stones. Objective is to get all of he own stones connected. You either move a stone or switch two stones in a line where you have the majority.

The gameboard is made up of leather and doubles as a pouch to hold all the pieces. There are two versions: The normal one and "Pajonk Extreme" with a bigger board

26166.name: Cinco de Mayo: The Battle of Puebla, 1862
26166.description:
CINCO DE MAYO is a game on the battle between a division of French troops in the army of Emperor Maximilian and those of the Republican forces of Mexico for control of the key city of Puebla, a battle that led to the Mexican national holiday honoring its date, May 5 (1862).

CINCO will use the same system as was used for both LINE OF FIRE and EAST-WEST, a firepower oriented version of the time-honored BSO system used in the MEN OF IRON system, with somewhat different focus. The battle itself uses some very interesting, colorful terrain, along with the usual units with the evocative names: 2nd Zouaves, the Fijo de Morelio Battalion, Chasseurs d’Affrique, the Oaxaca Lancers, etc. Special rules cover cavalry lancer charges, square formation, a rather early use of trenches, and artillery ammo.

Most of the rules and mechanics will be quite familiar to anyone who has played BSO games, but all with a nice period flavor.

Playing time for CINCO has averaged 2-3 hours, sometimes less, and the rules are only 9 pages.

CAVEAT: This battle will also be featured in an upcoming GMT module (for their GRINGO game) that will be published late 2007, early 2008. It uses a totally different more complex system, though

Each game of CINCO DE MAYO includes Rules, one sheet of Mike Lemick’s great-looking cut-and-paste counters, and a colorful Pascal da Silva 22”x17” game map and game cover.

26167.name: Galathea ekspeditionen
26167.description:
Follow in the footsteps of the Danish Galathea 3 expedition. The biggest Danish scientific expedition in 50 years. It plays two ways; get fastest through the ships route, or fill the log book first, both ways you have to have the right answers.

Contains: 1500 questions in the categories: Expeditions,nature & technology, history & culture and geography.
25 picture cards, 1 board, 6 game pieces, and a dice.

26168.name: Detectives
26168.description:
London 1905. Alan Baddy, sinister and evil character, greatest exponent of organized crime, tenaciously chased by Scotland Yard for his terrible misdeeds, has gone back to his old ways. Which detective will first locate the building where Alan Baddy committed the crime, finding the incriminating proof?
In this deductive game, first who plays Alan Baddy is randomly determined, the rest will play the astute detectives. The one playing Alan Baddy´s role will have to prepare the other elements of the game: decide in which building (11 pubs, restaurants and hotels altogether) the crime was committed, and assign the incriminatory proof (fingerprint, footprint and ring) of his crime to one of the buildings. All buildings will contain proof, but only one will contain the relevant ones with the required features.
During the game the detectives will have to search the different buildings on the board gathering clues in every one of them and making notes of them in their "Detective Notes" sheets, followed by Alan Baddy who'll do everything in his/her power to frustrate their quest.
The winner is that player who discovers in which building the crime was committed, contributing the proof which corroborates his/her hypothesis.

26169.name: Black Hole: Space Alert Game
26169.description: The game is based on the Disney movie "The Black Hole". Leave the explorer craft to explore the massive ghost ship Cygnus, but Cygnus is doomed! By drawing a playing cards, players must plot the fastest escape route, avoiding androids and Maximilian!

26170.name: Rocket Race to Saturn
26170.description: Using a spinner, players take turns moving their plastic spaceships through the solar system in a somewhat random order that eventually ends at Saturn. Players encounter obstacles on the way that may slow them down or help their progress. The first to reach Saturn wins.

26171.name: Tipsi!
26171.description: This is a four player game where the object to pick up one of four silver clay marbles at a time with a wooden spade. Players must then balance the marble as they attempt to deposit them it on top of a sort of column. The first player to successfully place four marbles is the winner.

26172.name: Baumhaus Club
26172.description:
What fun! A "house warming party" in a tree house! But first all of the children have to bring their toys, food, and tools up to the tree house. It's not so easy especially if you don't know where you've left your belongings! A lively game for memory training.

The game looks terrific, too, with great components and a good 3-D tree house.

26173.name: Duckys
26173.description: All sorts of things are happening on the water lily pond. Four pairs of ducks are now proud parents, and all of the ducklings have escaped from their nests and are now sitting on the island in the center of the pond. The parents face the difficult task of finding their baby ducklings so they can bring them back to their own nests.

26174.description:
Included in the box:
-2 84 x 64 cm rigid boards
-1 42 x 64 cm rigid board
-48 figures of the units
-18 figures of the generals
-Historical book
-Battle Guide
-Campaign guide
-Rules for the wargame
-80 chits
-2 deploy tables
-52 plastic bases

The set contains all the information about the battle of Bailen between the French and Spanish troops that took place in the little town of Bailen in Spain, plus a wargame to recreate it.

For more information: www.deltaediciones.com
26174.name: Bailen 1808

26175.name: Zing!
26175.description:
From the TLI Games website:

"Let the stories begin…..Zing! gives you a delicious set of words (with three difficulty levels). With those and a few of your own, you develop a sentence. You’ll score points for every Zing! word you use. Players take turns adding to your sentence until you have a story!

Can’t write? You’ll be surprised… Zing! brings you in and gets you creating, writing and laughing in a flash! Discover new ways of thinking.

And when the stories have been told (after a few twists and turns) the player with the most points wins!"

26176.name: It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown
26176.description:
From the Publisher:

It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown Board Game: Celebrate Halloween with Charlie Brown, Sally, Lucy and Snoopy! Help them dress up in their Halloween costumes and collect candy while Trick or Treating. Next it's a race through the Pumpkin Patch to reach Linus as he waits for The Great Pumpkin to rise. The first Peanuts pal to share their candy with Linus wins the game!

26177.name: The Take Away Game
26177.description:
You are a buyer for a Big Building in the States, for example, the Empire State Building or the Pentagon. It is your job to supply the building with beautiful and affordable lounge suites. The aim of the game is to collect Seats and Sofas lounge suites in six different colors for your building. However, to do this, you only have a limited amount of dollars at your disposal. The player who is the first to collect at least one lounge suite token in all six colors for his building is the winner of the game.
It is a game specially developed for a giant seller of furniture: Seats and Sofas.
Rules in Dutch and English.
There is a version with rules and cards in English and French.

boardgamehonor: 2004 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
2004 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
26178.description:
What a hullabaloo in the chicken coop! The little chickens are very hungry and the mother hens are looking for earthworms to feed them. Which chicken gets full the fastest?

This game won the Deutscher Lernspiel-preis in 2004.
26178.name: Chicky Picky

26179.name: Her Mit Dem Fisch
26179.description:
There is a lot going on in Adelie Land. Catch fish together with Mama and Papa Penguin and feed the little penguins. Be careful, as the little penguins can still help to catch the fish for dinner!

dupe of Hey, That's My Fish! ??

26180.name: Tirili
26180.description:
Making a nest, lining it with feathers, laying eggs, and taking care of the little birds is not as easy as it might seem. The bird parents are always therefore grateful for a bit of help. Who will be the first to have his three little birds in the nest?

Ages 4 and up.

26181.name: BrummSummsel
26181.description:
Leni and Frederick like walking over the brightly colored flower meadows in the summertime. There is a lot to discover there and they can admire the many different types of insects.

Most of all, the two of them like the fat cuddly bumblebees. They are a little bit clumsy as they fly around and make a particularly loud buzzing sound, but they are just as busy as bees when it comes to collecting the delicious nectar from the many blossoms.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
26182.description:
The castle dwellers are in a state of panic. Six dragons are prowling around the area, waiting for the opportunity to conquer the castle. Luckily, though, the valiant knights are on hand to help. By closing ranks and uniting forces, they battle to drive away the dragons.

A very fun game with a dexterity element to knock down the dragons by using a ramp like a cannon.

Castello del Drago is for ages 5 and up.
26182.name: Castello del Drago

26183.name: Valcapone
26183.description:
Valcapone is a clever pun for an economic gangster game. Of course the name sounds like Al Capone, but this game is by Valentin Herman so "Valcapone" fits well.

This is a more recent Fanfor design and that means it is a DTP publication that was printed in very limited edition and comes as a kit to cut out. Like most of Herman's games, this one is a business and economic game, although this time the theme is the gangster underworld as each player tries to make the most money illegally.

26185.name: Adams Ahn
26185.description: In 1907, gravel-pit worker Daniel Hartmann found a human lower jaw bone in the pit at Mauer, east of Heidelberg. However, this was no crime scene - it was a scientific sensation. Hartmann immediately realized the significance and burst into the local pub declaring that he had just found Adam! The jaw was actually from Homo heidelbergensis, about 600,000 years old, so not from Adam but from Adam's Ancestor (Adam's Ahn). Until recently it was the oldest known man or woman. This game has been made to mark the 100th anniversary of the discovery.

26186.description: 81 is an Essen 2006 release for Steffen Spiele. Following in their normal vein, it is an abstract game with multiple game variations. The board is a square of wood with a 9x9 grid of holes drilled in it. These are divided into nine quadrants, and thus with the nine differently colored pegs one can play "color sudoku" or one of three other games included. Great quality like all the other Steffen-Spiele games.

26188.name: Sabotage Pur
26188.description:
Sabotage Pur is a stripped-down version of the famous game by Robert Abbott, sold in limited release at Essen 2006. The game consists of two decks of cards with no board, and comes in a small bag making it easy to carry around. The gameplay is just as strong as the original but this is a much tidier package.

Re-implements: Sabotage

26189.description:
These expansions to the base game are available in the Spielbox magazine "Der Knizia Almanach I" and 6/06.

They are also available as free download from the Fantasy Flight Blue Moon City support page, and in German from the Reiner Knizia games pages at Cool Stuff.

The tiles are:

Der Knizia Almanach:
Hospital
Meeting Hall

Spielbox 6/2006:
Theater
Golden Shrine
boardgameversion: Fantasy Flight Print and Play download
26189.name: Blue Moon City: Expansion Tile Sets 1 & 2

26190.name: Master Thieves: Expansion Cards
26190.description:
An expansion set for the base game. This adds a set of 8 Robber cards along with rules in German, English, French and Spanish on how he affects the game.

The robber can steal from the thieves and the master thieves. If a thief or a master thief finds jewels, and a robber has been played, the robber's may steal one of the jewels starting in numeric order as in the cards. A robber may not steal the last jewel a thief has found. After stealing, the robber card is discarded.

The robber may also take a thief or a master thief as prisoner. If the thief or master thief drops jewels from the drawer, the robber may exchange the robber card with the thief or master thief card.

The robber never touches the cube.

The expansion was a give-away at Essen 2006 at the Zoch Spiel booth. Unfortunately the card-size did not match that of the original card set. Although it did not matter too much that they were slightly oversized, in 2007, the set was once again an Essen give-away, now with a matching card size.

Expands:

Master Thieves

26191.description:
A set of 7 new cards to mix in with those from the original game.

Expands

Mesopotamia
26191.name: Mesopotamia: Expansion

26192.description: The first course expansion for the game contains the tracks Hungaro Ring and Magny-Cours.
26192.name: Motorchamp: Course Collection I

26193.name: Cum Laude
26193.description: "El juego para apasionados del lenguaje" (The game for those passionate about language". Cum Laude is a trivia game focused on Spanish language, with questions on topics like Latin, Orthography and Etymology.

26194.name: Weißt du eigentlich, wie lieb ich dich hab?
26194.description:
the game is based on a children's book "Guess how much I love you" by Sam McBratney and Anita Jeram as the artist.

The game seems to be a "find the right pieces" game, where the child tries to find the right piece for each size of love. The size of the love is represented with strings that have little hearts at the ends. Unfortunately I only have the German rules, so I cannot confirm the rules.

26195.description:
This expansion gives your game 20 more ridiculous Rigs, 10 more hilarious Homes, 50 additional Go Redneckin' Cards and all-new charts for an even wilder ride on the Redneck Life journey through Blue Collar Americana!

Expands:

Redneck Life
26195.name: Redneck Life: Bustin' A Gut! Expansion

26196.description:
This is a game where you choose a character with some different stats, and then play cards and draw new cards from the stack until the stack runs out of cards. The one with the most "votes" in the end gets elected to high scool president and thus wins the game.

It's a humour-based, hilarious but rather complicated card game where a lot of the enjoyment relies on you knowing the clichées in japanese animation concerning high school comedy. Though there's a lot of japanese text on the cards, it's playable without knowledge of japanese if you have a translation sitting nearby. Moreover, you learn what the cards do rather quickly.

Game description
There are two card piles: the play card pile and the "standard vote"-pile. The "standard vote"-pile contains only cards with a number of votes, 1 to 6 on each card. The play card pile consists of special vote cards (can be worth a lot, and also may have special powers), action cards (that affect other players) or event cards (all players have to sumbit to certain conditions).

At your turn, you draw a play card and (unless it's an event card wich affets all players) may either take 2 actions OR draw yet another game card. Actions include drawing a standard vote card, playing a game card from your hand, or using a special power (from your special vote card or your character).

The "standard vote" cards are kept hidden, people can see how many you have but not how much they're worth. The special vote cards however, (which are worth much, representing votes from whole clubs like the baseball team, the newpaper club and so on), are placed before you. These can be "attacked" by action cards, either nullified or stolen. Some action cards can cancel other action cards, and some special votes cards can be immune to attacks like these if you discard cards from your hand etc.

So the game goes on until you've taken 2 laps through the draw pile of game cards. When the fourth event card is drawn, game ends immediately, and the person with most votes win.

As said, much of the flavour of this game consists of clichées in high school anime. The names of the standard vote-cards are sometimes hilarious. Some one-vote cards are named "the ghost girl who nobody has ever seen", "the maid robot", "the one who secretly goes to a certain market selling certain home made comics", other cards include "the I don't know whatever" (3 votes), "the ones with a boyfriend" (2 votes), "the diet girls" (4 votes) et cetera. The special vote cards are typical high school clubs in japanese high schools.

A very nice game but probably only for those who enjoy the style.
26196.name: High School Election

26197.name: Grailnah
26197.description:
The aim of the game is simple: the first player who has one of his Knights land on the center of the board has won in his quest for the Grail.

But be careful - your opponent has the same aim! He will do everything in his power to slow you down and to move his own knights forward ...

26198.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

The Race That Humiliated the Klingons!

The Vudar were a Klingon subject race. Due to their unique ability to tolerate radiation fields, the Vudar were allowed to build their own ships as Klingon police auxiliaries. Due to the radiation glare, the Klingons didn't realize how many ships the Vudar had built until the Vudar declared independence.

Or did any of this really happen? Since the idea of building a whole bunch of ships with the economic power of a single planet makes no sense, were the Vudar just a Klingon trick to convince the Hydrans to allow a "neutral" race to occupy half of the Kingdom?

Includes 45 new SSDs, eight new scenarios, and several new weapons including the Ion Cannon, Ion Pulse Generator, and Ion Storm Generator. 108 counters.
26198.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module F2 – The Vudar Enclave

26200.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

Includes all annexes from all SFB products (except Omega, E1, and E2). This includes about 50 pages of annexes and about 80 pages of the new and expanded Master Ship Chart. This product has a table of contents with page numbers and several new and expanded features.
26200.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module G2 – Master Annexes

26201.description:
This module formally introduces the Lesser Magellanic Cloud as a new setting for the Star Fleet Battles game system.

It includes a look at the history of the LMC through to the immediate aftermath of Operation Unity in Y202, a basic hex map of the LMC (which does not include the kind of planet and province data shown for the Alpha Octant in Federation and Empire), a series of rules governing the operation of numerous unique weapons and support systems found in this island galaxy, and backgound material and playtest ships for three major and two minor Magellanic factions: the Baduvai Imperium, the Eneen Protectorates, and the Maghadim Hives (collectively known as the Magellanic Powers, or the Triple Pact in the wake of the Andromedan invasion), plus the Uthiki Harmony, and the Jumokian Resistance/Pirates.

ADB have have listed an updated errata file covering all five currently-available playtest empires.
26201.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module C5 – The Magellanic Cloud

26202.name: MetalKrushers
26202.description:
MetalKrushers is an action-packed game of mobile metal mayhem. Players construct their Krushers by determining factors such as chassis size, weapons, shields, armor and more. Once built, players maneuver their Krushers into one of the futuristic arenas and the fast-paced melee begins. Krush or be krushed is the name of the game.

Take your place at the top of the heap, or become part of it.

MetalKrushers is a tactical board game of gladiatorial robot combat for two to six players ages 10 and up. The PDF includes a 14-page rulebook plus a page of Krusher sheets, a page of Krusher counters, two pages of charts, three pages of arena maps and a deluxe color cover. Players will need two six-sided dice and something to write with. Games can last from 30 minutes to an hour, depending on players.

26203.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

Huge Master Rulebook (over 400 pages) has all of the "rules" (no scenarios, annexes, or ship descriptions) from Basic Set, Advanced Missions, C1, C2, C3, J, J2, K, M, X, and Y1.

All rules have been integrated into a single continuous text, all errata has been incorporated, and some new clarifications and examples have been added.
26203.name: Star Fleet Battles Silver Anniversary Master Rulebook

26204.name: Spion & Spion
26204.description:
The goal of Spion & Spion — a retheme of Randolph's classic game Top Secret using Mad comic art from the Spy vs. Spy comic strip — is to break into the opposing embassy and steal the "BAZONG" (which is basically information in the form of a cello case) or collect 37 zillion dollars (37 coins) and buy one directly. To do so, you have three spy pawns in your color, which are numbered on the base from 1 to 3. (In the four-player game, which is kind of semi-cooperative, each teammate has his own spies.) You move on the game board only one space or draw a move card that lets you move 0-4 steps, gives you a benefit, or makes you lose the enemy's BAZONG should you possess it right now.

The game goes back and forth until one side collects 37 coins or manages to steal the BAZONG from the other player/team and transport it to the home embassy.

Spion & Spion is not be to be confused with Spy vs Spy, an entirely different game by the same publisher, published in the same year and using the same theme...

26205.name: Monopoly: Euro
26205.description: Monopoly Euro is a Monopoly version celebrating the upcoming Euro. The towns are replaced by EU countries and stations are big European airports as Heathrow. The pawns are well-known EU tourist attractions such as the Eiffel Tower and Coliseum.

26206.description:
This game was published in 1988 in association with Frankfurt International Airport - Flughafen Franfurt Main - in Germany. It comprises two distinct games, the "Passenger Game", in which players race to move their passengers through the airport, whether arriving, departing or in transit, and the "Air Traffic Control Game", in which players attempt to move their planes using the least amount of energy.

The game provides publicity for Frankfurt International Airport and was later reissued simply titled Airport, without the Frankfurt branding, by Verlag Herder.
26206.name: International Airport FRA

26207.description:
Dicewords is a new game in a small tube from Graham Lipscomb, which has 9 colored dice with different combinations of letters. Players take turns re-rolling the dice to get the best score. The key is the Word Table which enables players to make better decisions about which words are possible with the unwanted rolls.

Dicewords is a word dice game.
26207.name: Dicewords

26208.name: Charmed: Le Pouvoir des Trois
26208.description: In Charmed - the Power of Three, the players strive to obtain the coveted Power of Three. Each player is one of the characters of the TV series, either one of the three Halliwell sisters (Piper, Paige, Phoebe), or one of the three leaders of the underworld (the Source, Cole Turner, the Seer). The players act in teams, using the powers of their characters to overcome their adversaries.

26209.name: Kaappikellon kummitukset
26209.description:
The grandfather clock in the Pimpola Manor has stopped. Turns out that there are ghosts living inside the clock, and they don't like the striking of the clock. In order to get the clock working again, you have to find a new place for the ghosts to live in. Luckily, in the attic there's a wardrobe in which all the ghosts could easily fit.

This is a simple roll-and-move game. The first player to get all his ghosts inside the wardrobe wins. On the way to the attic there are four special spaces. Whenever a ghost lands on one of these spaces, it might sneak out for a nap, go doing pranks, or simply run back into the grandfather clock.

This game belongs to Peliko's line of children's games illustrated by Mauri Kunnas. Included in the box are a game board, a wardrobe, a die, and 16 ghosts in four player colors.

26210.name: City Blocks
26210.description: City Blocks is an abstract game of placing “pentomino” pieces onto a 20 by 20 square board for 2 or 4 players. Each player takes turns either placing a single piece onto the board or passing. When all players pass in the same round the game ends, scores are calculated and the winner announced. Points are scored for the largest single area that each player has covered and for each edge bordering an empty square on the board.

26211.description:
You secretly assign your pickers and planters to the different orchards. Then everyone executes their actions. The people later in the round may get cut out of the fruit picking.
Next each person in order has a chance to send their fruits to the fair to win prizes (vp) or hire another worker.
After that who ever has the most fruit in each of the four types wins a special ability. The ability you can win with each fruit can change at the end of the turn. When there are only a certain number of prizes left the game ends and you add up your prizes and remaining fruit to see who wins.

Despite the name, no food fighting involved.
26211.name: Fruit Fair
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #101 - How You Like Them Apples?

26212.name: Convivium Cooking Game
26212.description:
A Unique Game that Results in a Meal!

Organize your next dinner party, supper club or get-together around the Convivium Cooking game, a fun party game idea that results in a meal. Dinner party guests answer trivia, create toasts and play name-that-tune to reach the finish line, where they'll be assigned cooking jobs to help create a three course meal. The game includes invitations, recipe cards, ingredients and equipment lists, and a step-by-step guide.

Participants complete all cooking after playing each round using the finish line instruction cards. The Game often gets interesting as teams position for various responsibilities for that particular course.

Get ready for a great evening! Convivium is designed to facilitate conversation during that game as well as prepare a 3-course meal. This makes for a complete evening so set aside approximately 45 minutes for each round if you want to play the entire game (if you want a shorter game you can reduce the number of rounds - it's completely up to you).

26213.name: Gaia's Garden
26213.description:
A cooperative game of organic vegetable gardening.

Players role dice to move gardeners, pests, and predators around a track. The gardeners can plant vegetables in empty plots, in accordance with certain planting rules about which vegetables can be planted together. Pests (bugs) eat vegetables, unless they are in turn eaten by predators (birds).

The players win jointly if the garden is fully planted, or lose if it is overrun by pests.

26214.name: Barella
26214.description:
From the publisher:

Let's barbecue! Most people like barbecued stuff but it's not easy preparing a barbecued meal. A Bar-B-Que is just starting. Who will grill the most things? Play the game with 15 pieces of meat, 12 flames, 1 sand glass, 1 grill (to be assembled by 5 grey sticks), 1 set of tongs, 1 plate and 1 action dice.

All bamboo components.

26215.name: Don't Point the Finger
26215.description:
In Der magische Finger (The magic finger), a life sized green hand crawls around the table. It rotates around the thumb planted in the middle of the table, until it stops and points at a person.
They are given the choice between 'TRUTH' (eg. Have you ever stolen anything;What's the best thing about the person on your left) and 'DARE' (ie. Act like you're cleaning the room; pretend you're 90 years old) If the other players don't think you have done a good enough job they can make you do the punishment (ie. name 5 composers while everyone else counts to 10). First player to six points wins.

(tons of German on the cards/no English)

26216.name: Feuerberg von Sabine Erdmann
26216.description:
The families around fire mountain are going out in a storm to bring fire back to the caves. You have to place little pieces of wick in the cracks in the board from your cave to the fire (tea candle) in the middle. Your cave contains a match and whomever's match lights first wins. There are also some marbles than can be placed to block routes.

38 cm ceramic board

Adult supervision required***

26217.name: V. L. C.: Very Large Creature
26217.description:
In the 27th century, earth faced a pollution problem of monumental proportion. To combat this problem, a new breed of genetically engineered creatures was created. These creatures could consume pollutants and scrap materials (they are also designed to be cute and machine washable). Unfortunately, some of these VERY LARGE CREATURES, or V.L.C.'s have gone rogue and are now eating cities. Can you stop them?

VLC allows you to take your stuffed animals and wage war with them against your miniatures. Because of the nature of the VLC world, any minis are usable, from fantasy, to 20th century soldiers, to futuristic vehicles and aircraft.

One player controls the V.L.C. bent on eating another city. The other player plays the cities inhabitants, militia and army forces. These troops are armed with swords, spears, rifles, ray-guns or whatever you can find in the way of army men or other minis.

Don't worry, the V.L.C.'s don't eat people, and if a V.L.C. is destroyed, its unique biology allows it to reform after the game. This makes combat a non-lethal affair.

So take that teddy bear, rabbit, Cthulu or whatever stuffed animals you have, and reek some havoc.

26218.description:
Dragon Realm is a first expansion for a popular adventure fantasy game Prophecy. In Dragon Realm you will be exploring one of the astral spheres, that hides powerful artifacts. Flying through the mountains you meet lots of new adventures, and you either return as a wealthy and powerful hero, or wounded with empty pockets. It depends only on you.

Dragon Realm brings races into game, so you can possibly play a dwarf mercenary, or elven ranger. Nothing restricts you to play any combination, from troll wizard to halfling warrior, any combination is possible and again it depends only on your game style.

In the box, you also find new adventures for the basic board, new skills and several minor rule changes.

Expands:

Prophecy
26218.name: Prophecy: Dragon Realm

26219.description:
In Prophecy: Water Realm, the second expansion for the Prophecy fantasy adventure game, you will be invited to enter another astral sphere. Dive into unknown depths and try to recover mighty artifacts guarded by mythical monsters and deadly water maelstroms. If you venture deep into the Water Realm, you'll return with pockets full of gold and treasure - assuming you manage to return, that is.

That's not all! There is an isolated island where the most famous pirate of all time hides the most powerful items ever created by a human. During your adventures, search for fragments of an old map that show you the way to the treasure.
26219.name: Prophecy: Water Realm

26220.description:
From site:

It is the 23rd Century, and the Solar System is on the brink of war.

Jovian Confederation carrier groups and their elite exo-armor pilots prepare for the impending clash with CEGA, while the Venusians manipulate events from the shadows. Who will triumph? Now you can decide!

Victory by Any Means: Jovian Chronicles brings the pulse-pounding action of Dream Pod 9’s Jovian Chronicles saga together with the strategic sweep of the Victory by Any Means Campaign System.

Included in this book is everything you need to play out the epic scope of events in the Solar System of the 23rd Century in the wake of the Odyssey and the Battle of Kurtzenheim with the VBAM system, including:

New orbital installations to replicate orbital colonies and industry

New unit special abilities to model Exo-Armors and Exo-Suits

Guidelines for resolving scenarios with DP9’s Lightning Strike™

New objective system for determining victory

Three exciting scenarios – the 2214 Scenario, the Open Scenario, and the Intro Scenario.

Complete force lists for all factions of the Jovian Chronicles

Background and details for the Jovian Chronicles and all of its factions are included, including descriptions of ships, fighters, exo- armors and exo-suits.

Conversion rules for using RPG characters in VBAM and guidelines for how to turn VBAM activities and events into RPG scenarios

This is not a stand-alone product and requires the Victory by Any Means Campaign Guide (VBM-101) to fully use. Ownership of the Lightning Strike 2nd Edition Rules (DP9-322), Lightning Strike Companion (DP9-324) and Campaign Moderator’s Companion (VBM-105) are recommended.

Expands:

Victory By Any Means: Campaign Guide
Victory By Any Means: Campaign Moderator's Companion
26220.name: Victory by Any Means: Jovian Chronicles
boardgamefamily: Victory By Any Means Campaign Series

26221.name: Magori
26221.description:
From the publisher:

Little wizards use their magic to change stones into gold. Some little wizards may get help from the fairy, if they can find her. But watch out: the magic stones try to escape. The game contains 10 gold pieces, 10 magic stones, 8 picture cards, 1 action dice, 1 magic basket and 1 magic wand.

26222.name: Parodi
26222.description: The game consists of cards, each of which contains two lines from more or less famous German poems (in the widest sense, from the classics to advertising slogans). These cards have to be combined into new creative output, with the other players judging the quality of the results. Winning is secondary to a good laugh.

26223.name: Cronulla 2230
26223.description:
From the rules:
"The object of the game is to become the wealthiest person in the Sutherland Shire through the buying, renting, and selling of property.
The gaining of such wealth will enable you to fund patriotic organizations like Australia First and the Patriotic Youth League, so they can get into parliament and Win Back Australia! "

(Note the game only simulates the former; the latter is left to the imagination of the players)

This print and play PDF game is essentially Monopoly, with title deeds, colors and payouts lifted from that game. Locations are all relative to the Sutherland Shire of Southern Sydney, Australia.

Chance and Community Chest are replaced by "Aussie Luck" cards, of which the majority are xenophobic.

Nationalist group Australia First has already moved to distance itself from the game, posting a statement on its website.

"This product is not an Australia First product, despite the 'game' mentioning the party at various points."

The revision listed in the rules is 2006 v.2.0

26224.name: Tembo
26224.description: Help to protect the elephant. Look after the game reserve, stop bushfires, help with diseases or catch poachers.

26225.name: Caroti
26225.description:
From the publisher:

One sunny day the farmer was going to plant his field. But oh, no! His carrots were gone! He saw only an empty field with somebody's footprints. "Oh, those pesky rabbits!" he says. To protect his carrot crop, the farmer asks a big, clumsy dog to guard it. Thus begins the competition between the tricky rabbits and the big clumsy dog. Contains 16 walk chips, 8 carrots, 4 colorful tricky rabbits, 1 big clumsy dog, 1 field pad (tied up with rope) and 1 action dice.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Winner
26226.description: Flexible caterpillars with different colored accents hide in the natural bamboo cylinder and are enticed out during the game as the 2-6 players take turns with two different dice -- one for color and one for direction. Can't Stop with worms?
26226.name: Rapelli

26227.name: Skarbnica Gier
26227.description:
"Skarbnica Gier" means "The Games Treasury". It is a compendium of abstract board games compiled by Lech Pijanowski - a Polish game expert and designer. The games he described are of three categories: traditional games (about 40%); modern games by various authors (about 40%, a lot by Sid Sackson); and finally his own creations (about 20%).

The package has a unique form of a double book. The left one contains the rules of the games, the right one the figures. Such a design simplifies understanding examples a lot! Four chessboards are added as separate inserts: 8x8, 10x10, 12x12 and a "domino-board" 6x12.

Chapters of the book:
- 8x8 board games (8)
- 10x10 board games (12)
- 12x12 board games (4)
- domino games (12)
- pencil & paper games (12)
- simple accessories games (6)
- sophisticated accessories games (10)

26228.name: Whirligo
26228.description:
The game of Whirligo is for 2, 3, or 4 players. The Shaker is used by shaking the balls in the large end and then by up-ending it, three different colored balls appear in the stem. The moves depend on the sequence of these colors.

As the colored balls in the Shaker match the colored dots on the player's path, the player can add counters to his spiral path. The winner is the player who can make his spiral path of counters reach the winning post at the center of the board first.

26229.description:
Hexchess is a game of chess for 2 to 3 players played with standard chess pieces, but on a 6-sided hexagonal board.
With two players, pieces are set up in opposing corners; with three in alternating corners.

There are 3 different end games the players decide on before the game starts:

One King is captured by the winner, the third player earns a draw
One King is checkmated by one or both opponents. The defeated pieces to not move, but can be captured. The two remaining players continue
Similar to 2, except the defeated pieces cannot be captured.




The pieces move as similarly to regular chess pieces as possible:

The King moves one space.
The Queen moves along a row or chain.
The Bishop moves along a chain.
The Rook moves along a row.
The Knight moves two spaces up and one over.
The Pawn move along a row one space at a time.




A chain is a line of hexagons of the same color.
A row is a line of different colored hexagons sharing a common side.
26229.name: Hexchess

26230.name: Restefix
26230.description: Restefix is a box full of wooden blocks. Players place the blocks on the table in turns to make specific patterns and score points. A very limited release game by Edition Perlhuhn, and each copy has a box that was hand-painted.

26231.name: Oppression
26231.description:
Oppression is a game of International Politics and Power that will captivate you from the start. Stimulating, informative and easy to play, yet it will leave you totally ????

This game highlights the oppressiveness of the apartheid regime in South Africa.

26232.name: Trimmel
26232.description:
A Liar's Dice-like game. The players try to get as few minus points as possible. One player gets the writing pad and writes down the names of all players under a preprinted face. The active player rolls the three dice inside a cup and announces a result. He's free to tell the truth or to bluff. The next player can contest the result or continue with the next throw, in which he has to have a higher result than the player before him.
Whenever a player is contesting the result the cup is turned over and the player who's wrong gets a minus point. If a player gets a pair, a trimmel (three similar numbers) or a street he gets bonus points. Whenever a player gets a drilling of six he can reveal his throw and distribute 5 minus points among the other players. Whenever all but one player have six minus points the game ends.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee
2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Third Place
2007 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
2010 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
26233.description:
Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.
26233.name: Manymals

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
26234.name: Wer hat's?
26234.description:
Wer's hat? (Who Has It?) is a game in which speech and memory are trained. Two objects make up a rhyming pair, so that the player has to listen carefully if, for example, "Track" or "Rack" was said. But the rhyming pairs aren't what are sought: the two matching items are instead.

Chaos in the children's room! Louisa and her friends had just finished sorting her possessions, but suddenly her little brother showed up and threw everything into disorder again. So they have to start over again with the collecting and sorting.... Who has the matching item?

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2009 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
26235.description:
There used to be friendly competition among co-workers at the Apple Factory during Bonus Week, as workers made a special effort to Pick & Pack those crates with quality apples.

But this year the mechanical arm has broken down...

Now it takes two people to get it to work. One set of controls operates left and right, the other set operates up and down. Now you are competing directly with your partner to get the most apples. Can you grab the premium apples while leaving your partner with wholesale fodder? Can you exploit a rush order, or throw a wrench in the works? Quality control and order mix-ups also add to the fun.

In the end, the player with the most apples in their crates wins.
26235.name: Pick & Pack

boardgamehonor: 2006 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
26236.description: The little caterpillars are very excited because they are to get brightly colored clothes today. There is a great selection because there are many different colors and they come in a great variety of shapes. It's not easy to choose, and so the caterpillars decide to throw the dice to decide on the new clothes. One piece is threaded on after another, depending on what comes up.
26236.name: Colorful Caterpillars

26237.name: Pomela
26237.description:
Today Kim and Andy have to get up particularly early because they are going with their granddad to the large meadow outside of the village. There are a lot of fruit trees there, and as the apples have turned a dark-red shiny color over the last few days, they are ripe for picking. Granddad has promised to make sweet jam for the two of them if they pick a lot of apples, but picking them without dropping them can be a challenge!

Contents:
• 1 apple tree (235 x 185 x 3,5 mm)
• 2 fruit pickers
• 10 apples
• 30 winning tokens (jam jars)
• 1 sand glass
• 1 basket
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

26238.name: Holli Polli
26238.description:
The bees are busy because the little baby bees in their honeycombs are waiting to be fed. While the bees are sucking the sweet nectar out of the flowers, their yellow and black fluffy bodies pick up pollen. This pollen is used to feed the baby bees so that they will soon be able to fly themselves from flower to flower.

Ages 3 and up.

26239.description:
The way to the golden apple has some obstacles along it but it is worth it because you are able to make a wish when you eat it. Quick to the horses and up to the golden mountain! If you are lucky, you will be first to the top of the hill, and your wish will be granted.

Ages 3 and up.
26239.name: Goldener Apfel

26240.name: Anton's Schwimmschule
26240.description: The hedgehog swimming lessons are about to begin. The other friends have already collected corks. The winner is the first hedgehog to put four corks into his spines.

26241.name: Arthur and the Minimoys: The Search for Archibald
26241.description:
The smallest heroes can sometimes achieve the greatest exploits.

Arthur, 10 years old, has many concerns. A dreadful property developer wants to seize the house of his grandmother. The only solution to save it is to find the treasure hidden with the country of the Minimoys by his/her father Archibald... who disappeared 4 years ago. Return Arthur to the country of Minimoys. In the role of the one of the 4 heroes of film, you leave to search for Archibald.

Traverse the kingdom of the Seven Grounds until Nécropolis. But do so quickly, because the cruel villain has decided to flood the village. While the water level rises up to dangerous levels, traverse the 5 levels of the game. Fight horrible creatures, answer questions about the universe of Arthur and, ultimately, find Arthur's father before it is too late!

In the search of Archibald is a game of action and adventure which will charm all the fans of the most famous of miniature heroes.

26242.description:
There is a lot of lively activity on the large, brightly colored wildflower meadow. The bees in particular are busy collecting honey blossoms. Unfortunately, they are not alone because the honey bear is also very partial to these honey blossoms and for that reason the bees need a little luck with the dice.

Ages 4 and up.
26242.name: Honigbär

26243.name: Ia-Quak-Miau
26243.description:
All the children in the neighborhood come with their animals to take part in the great animal auction. In spite of the general confusion and noise, you must pay close attention to the auction because only the quickest to react will be able to bring the animals he buys into the right pens on the pasture grounds.

Ages 4 and up.

26244.description:
Tobi and his little sister Lisa are given a big bag of sweets but because the two of them pull at it together, the bag tears and the sweets fall out. What a mess! The sweets have to be picked up quickly! Concentration and quick reaction are needed to do this.

In the rules there are 3 different suggestions on how to play this game, but in a nutshell you roll the 3 color dice and try to find the piece of candy (or sock, in another version) that has all the colors rolled. The first player to spot it may either take it or score a point (depending on the way you play it).
26244.name: Candy

26245.name: Die Maulwurf Bande
26245.description: A memory game that also encourages logical thinking. Each mole tries to be the first to collect his four toys.

26246.name: Spelauteurs Nederland
26246.description:
This game is single small board showing an oval track with various colored lanes. The lanes are divided into sections, and 11 spaces are scattered about. Coming with this board is a bag with some color-sided dice, one D6, and some colored chips.

Three Dutch game authors, who have created their own game designers forum, have each produced a different game using some or all of these components. The rules for each game are downloadable from their website, www.spelauteurs.nl . This is a nice idea and one meant to promote the support of game design in the Netherlands.

26248.name: Sudoku: Das Würfelspiel
26248.description: Another in the Knizia series of Sudoku games, following "The Board Game" and "The Card Game". This time it's with dice, the Sudoku grid is made simpler with only six numbers to accommodate standard dice.

26249.name: Krizovky
26249.description: Each player starts with a certain number of puzzle pieces with has printed on them capital letters and a small number (value). Each player makes a word in his/her turn and counts the value of the word and adds it to the players total value. It is like scrabble but there is no board to play on, so it is very flexible in its area.

26250.description:
On 18 July 1936, various generals in the Spanish army rose up against the government of the Second Republic. The failure of the coup as it had been originally planned gave way to a civil conflict between the defenders of the democratic government and the backers of the military coup. Machado’s two Spain's fought each other for nearly three years in a battle which reflected the political and social tensions affecting the world at that time.

The opposing armies were very different: on one hand, the Republican army possessed a limited number of professional soldiers and many popular militias belonging to political parties and labor unions. To this were added the International Brigades, formed from foreign volunteers of diverse origin; a fighting force which was highly motivated, but poorly coordinated and typically poorly organized. On the other hand, the Franco´s army had most of the professional military, along with Carlist and fascist militias, many native Moroccan troops, and the volunteers of the Condor Legion and the Corpo Trupe Voluntarie, sent by Hitler and Mussolini, respectively.

From a military point of view, the Spanish Civil War presaged the global conflict which would soon erupt. In the mid-1930s, military high commands from all over the globe theorized on the possibilities of motorized armies and “lightning war”. Both Nazis and Soviets rehearsed armored tactics in Spain, and tested various types of weapons. In addition, the importance that air superiority would have on all later conflicts was made clear. All of these elements make the Spanish Civil War a fascinating conflict from an historical point of view and with regard to military strategy.

To the Barricades!, the first title in the War Storms series, is a game which attempts to simulate, at platoon and company level, the battles which took place on the different fronts of the war. The rules are oriented towards the tactical simulation of combat involving armored vehicles, infantry, artillery, and aircraft, and as such they are especially suited to represent almost any 20th century armed conflict as it actually happened.
26250.name: A las Barricadas!

26251.name: Zick Zack Ziege
26251.description: Tactics and a bit of luck with the dice are called for here. The winner is the player whose team of three goats reaches the mountain peak first.

26252.name: Der Glöckner
26252.description: An exciting game of dice, where you win or lose together. The object of the game is to build the tower together. If the tower is ready before the bell-ringer reaches his last space, everyone has won. However, if the tower is not finished by this time, everyone has lost.

26253.name: Mecki & Co.
26253.description:
A game with 120 hedgehog spines! Players try to fully "outfit" their hedgehog with spines before everyone does, using a counting mechanism to help train facility with numbers.

Ages 4 and up.

PROMOTES FIRST COUNTING AND FINE MOTOR SKILL.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (370 x 370 x 10 mm)
• 120 spines
• 1 basket
• 1 dice (1-3)
• 1 dice (1-6)
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

26254.name: Bingo Bongo
26254.description: Green jungle everywhere, a large palm tree with the last coconut of the season and some very cheeky monkeys. Be careful, only the fastest up the truck will get the coconut!

26255.description:
Four teddies are about to start a big journey and have to get their belongings ready to pack in their suitcases. However, suitcases should look tidy and therefore the children have to find the right pairs (tooth brush and water glass, for example).

Ages 3 and up.
26255.name: Teddies on Tour

26256.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

They said it would never be done, but here it is! Module R10 includes new plasma torpedo options and variants of the New Heavy Cruisers, giving all of those War Cruiser Variants increased combat power and survival.

Plasma Torpedo upgrades:


Plasma Sabot - a faster plasma torpedo
ECM Plasma - a torpedo that generates supporting ECM
Plasma Carronade - a new way of firing a plasma bolt


There are 79 new ships including:


Federation New Command Cruiser
New Strike Carrier
New Fast Cruiser
New Drone Cruiser
New Survey Cruiser
New Division Control Ship
New Cruiser Leader
New Heavy Fighter Carrier
New Heavy Scout
New Aegis Escort



Klingon New Heavy Cruiser Leader
New Strike Carrier
New Fast Heavy Cruiser
New Drone Bombardment Cruiser
New Survey Cruiser
New Fast Patrol Tender
New Division Control Ship
New Penal Cruiser
New Heavy Scout Cruiser
New Diplomatic Cruiser
New Escort Cruiser
New Mauler Cruiser
New Commando Cruiser
New Drone Cruiser
New Stasis Cruiser



Romulan FireHawk-B carrier
Firehawk-E PF tender
FireHawk-S Scout
RegalHawk-B carrier
RegalHawk-E PF tender
RegalHawk-C Scout
FlameHawk-P true mauler
New Heavy KR
New Heavy KR Scout
New Heavy KR Carrier



Kzinti New Command Cruiser
New Strike Carrier
New Fast Cruiser
New Scout Cruiser
New Command Cruiser
New Drone Cruiser
New Survey Cruiser
Heavy PF Tender
New Division Control Ship
New Escort Cruiser



Gorn Fast Medium Cruiser
Medium Survey Cruiser
Medium Fast Patrol Tender
Medium Commando Cruiser
Medium Division Control Ship
Medium Carrier
Medium Scout Cruiser
Heavy Destroyer Dreadnought



Tholian New Heavy Cruiser
New Photon Cruiser



Orion Heavy Battle Carrier
Heavy Battle PF Tender



Hydran New Command Cruisers
New Medium Carrier
New Fast Cruiser
New Survey Cruiser
Medium PF Tender
Division Control Ship
New Tug
Heavy Escort Cruiser
Heavy Scout Carrier
