26384.description: Wedrenspel is a Dutch vintage game about horse riding, it was released either in the '50s or '60s. The game contains a board with an oval racetrack on it and 6 wooden horses that represent the pawns.

26386.name: RPGQuest: Oriental Adventures
26386.description:
A Brazilian RPG which includes an Ancient Chinese-themed Risk-like game.

From the publisher:

RPGQUEST - Oriental adventures bring rules to start to play an RPG and to create characters, who can be chosen amongst 9 new Classes (Yamabushi, Ninja, Samurai, Ronin, Monge Shaolin, Shinobi, Kunoichi, Wu Jen and Komuso). As examples, the book includes six characters ready to play, with counters and miniatures, besides the possibility of creation one own's character. RPGQuest also includes complete rules for the GamesMaster and tips on creating adventures, 83 colorful 3-D paper miniatures (representing adventurers, NPCs and sets of ten warriors of the 5 Imperial Armies, including a Silver Dragon), 216 counters of Soldiers for epic battles and 2 colorful maps size 82x55 cm, ready to play! As a bonus, the RPGQuest will include a wargame, that is a game of strategy in the style of War (the Brazilian version of Risk), but more elaborate, where each player controls troops, ships, Heroes, Generals and an Emperor of one of the 5 Empires and must gain the biggest number of Victory Points, conquering new territories, defeating its opponents, constructing cities and temples and resisting the terrible attack of the Kappas.

Written by Marcelo Del Debbio and Luka-Chan, all the setting is based on Eastern legends and stories and the "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" mythology.

26387.name: Men in Black 2
26387.description: Based upon the movie with the same name. You play one of the characters of the movie in a quest to save the earth from the extra terrestrials. In your quest you have to prove your courage by completing some tasks, and this has to be done fast because Serleena, chief of the extra terrestrials is not wasting time. Although based on a movie, this boardgame looks very much like a Monopoly board with a theme pasted upon it.

26388.name: Devereaux County
26388.description:
It’s beautiful. It’s rural. It’s haunted. A series of grisly murders and mysterious apparitions has torn apart the peaceful countryside of Devereaux County. Now you can take on the role of one of four ghost hunters and rid the county of its restless spirits.

In this Gothic horror boardgame, players select and place haunts to confound their opponents. Then they take on the role of a ghost hunter, uncovering and defeating the haunts placed by the other players. All this happens in the deeply disturbing, yet beautiful and historic, milieu of back-country Devereaux County. With 80 haunts and four relics, play variations are endless!

Not recommended for children under 12, due to dark and twisted themes and flavor text.

26390.description:
Imprisoned in the net - the spider can catch their booty by tactical acting.
The wooden gameboard (ca. 61x61 cm) consists of 64 playing fields and 4 center zones for the spiders. The goal of the game is to catch as many flies as possible (in the form of stones). The spiders may move horizontally and vertically. They try to reach and catch a fly according to the rolled dice.
In the advanced variant one can intentionally limit the course of the spider.
This spider game is suitable to learn the useful aspects of these animals. In the testing phase we could state that many humans could diminish their shyness and fear of spiders and become curious about these creatures.
26390.name: Gefangen im Netz

26391.name: Cavalcade
26391.description:
Cavalcade by Selchow & Righter Co. is described as America's Racing Classic. The game comes with 6 horses, play money, die, 6 hurdles and a felt racetrack.

Players place wagers on the horses and die are rolled to move them. Hurdles can be used to indicate obstacles or used in the steeplechase race.

Here are the outstanding features of Cavalcade...

1. A Racing Game for all ages.
2. Any number of players may participate.
3. Has realistic circular felt race track.
4. Plastic horses and wooden hurdles.
5. Plenty of paper play money for placing bets.
6. Large dice easy to read.
7. Original "Hurdle Feature" unlike any other racing game.
8. Players can play any type of race they desire.

26392.name: Qué n'Afêre à Lîdje
26392.description: This Belgian Trivia game is about the Province of Liège and it's history. There are also three pawns in the game. The different pawns represent 'Charlemagne', 'Lantin Prison' and 'Tchantès'. Players can lose or win the game by answering trivia questions.

26394.name: Championship Drag Racing: Top Fuel Edition
26394.description:
From the publisher's description:

"After years of trying, I’ve finally arrived at a final product in which I’m extremely happy, and I think captures the sport as best as possible. And while rolling a game of Championship Drag Racing will take a bit longer than a 4.5 second Elapsed Time, I really think the flow of the game is done very well. The average gamer should easily be able to knock out an event in a single sitting while experiencing all of the drama and excitement of a real-life drag racing event."

"Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen."

"In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!"

"Championship Drag Racing: Top Fuel Edition gives you every Top Fuel Racer that made a successful qualifying attempt in 2005. You also get all 23 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule, complete points standings, complete final ladders for each event, as well as a list of drivers that attempted to make every field are included."

The standard game is printed in black and white. The Deluxe edition of the game is printed in full color.

26395.description:
[From Publisher] The spider kids want to climb up the belly of Spider Mum. Be careful - otherwise Spider Mum slips through the web and all the spiders will fall off! A piling game for 2-5 skillful players.

[From Submitter] Quality produced wooden game of stacking spiders on a mother spider mounted on a web which is a genius web of elastic bands. The game is highly playable by both kids and adults as well with equal fun.
26395.name: Purzelspinne

26396.name: Championship Drag Racing: 2005 Funny Car Edition
26396.description:
From the publisher's description:

"Re-live the excitement of the 2005 Funny Car Season. The 2005 Season was one of the closest Points races in the history of the sport. The top 3 drivers were separated by a mere 32 points, and the top 10 in points were separated by an amazing 442 points."

"Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen."

"In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!"

"Championship Drag Racing: Funny Car Edition gives you every Funny Car Racer that made a qualifying attempt in 2005. You also get all 23 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule, complete points standings, complete final ladders for each event, as well as a list of drivers that attempted to make every field are included."

26397.name: Full Pull
26397.description:
"Experience all of the drama and excitement of professional tractor pulling with Full Pull the new simulation from Downey Games."

"Full Pull includes 48 of the best Super Modified tractors from all over the world. The Super Modified Class is unlimited horse power with no restrictions on engines. Many of the top tractors have multiple big block engines or multiple airplane engines."

"Full Pull simulates every facet of the sport from mechanical failures to full pulls."

26398.name: Eco-Logica
26398.description: Eco-Logica is a game for children ages 8 to 14 years old. It let's the child realize that there are certain problems with our environment that threaten the earth. The gameboard carries a drawing of a sad world. During the play the child is stimulated to find the right answers to ecological problems. The goal of the game is to get back a smile on the earth on the board. The game contains a board, a spinning device (with the image of a sad world), 1 die, 6 pawns, 6 cards with ecological issues, 16 chips, 16 cards with illustrations of ecological problems (like some animal species that are threatened to be distinguished), 55 solution cards and a manual of the game.

26399.name: Tailgate Racing
26399.description:
A three-in-one racing game with an oval stock cars track, drag strip, and road course track. Comes in two versions, one with racing cars and the other without if you want to use your own 1:64 scale cars.

From the publisher's description:

"All the moves of racing: Entry Fee, Qualifying for Pole/Starting Grid Position, Start, 2-3 Wide Racing, Drafting, Blocking, Penalties, Crashing, Restarts, Finish, WIN $$$$."

"Game Includes: 3 Different Type Tracks, Gold Trophy, Dice, $5400 Money-Dek Cards, 10 assorted colors and model 2-1/2" Race Cars, TR Rules, Ez Transport/stowage container."

"Game Surface: Sized to accommodate 1/64th" collectibles, 2 sided, drink, food & water proof picnic table sized playing area, doubles as a large place mat table covering/mega sized racing game surface (28" x 60")."

"Realism: Just like racing where skill and luck come into play. Accommodates everybody's preference, use Dice, Playing Cards or both."

26400.name: Wróg u bram: Stalingrad 1942
26400.description:
Wróg u bram: Stalingrad 1942 (Enemy at the gates) - 2-player game simulating one of the most interesting episodes of WWII.
This game depends strongly on a card playing mechanism. There are three types of cards: Commanders (most important), Units, and HQ Cards.
Commanders determine strength and size of your corps. They also determine your ability to play and modify HQ Cards.
Units consist of infantry, artillery and armored units.
HQ Cards are responsible for modifying battle results and the overall game situation - kind of special cards.

26401.description:
The ATS game engine has been ported to the ACW period by Lieutenant Colonel Mark Johnson, author of That Body of Brave Men—The U.S. Regular Infantry and the Civil War in the West (in bookstores now) and the art is by renowned Civil War artist Alan Archambault.

ATS Gettysburg is a tactical-level game covering combat during the 3-day Battle of Gettysburg on July 1-3, 1863.

Period maps have been combined with a fresh battlefield examination by George Anderson. The maps portray Bliss Farm and MacPherson's Ridge, two intensely fought-over battle sites.

Each hex represents 50 yards of terrain and each game turn represents about 90 seconds of real time. Personnel units represent officers, couriers, color guards (6-8 men), artillery crews, and cavalry and infantry units (approximately 20-25 men). Each gun or vehicle counter represents one artillery piece or horse-drawn vehicle.

Scenarios will cover action on McPherson's Ridge on Day 1, and at the Bliss Farm over Days 2 and 3.
26401.name: Gettysburg: Turning Point 1863

26402.name: Your Surprise Package
26402.description:
The object of the game is to guess what prize you are about to win. A player begins the round with the cash value of the secret prize. Cash is taken away for each clue given about the prize and the time used by the player in asking yes-or-no questions about the prize. The player with highest value in cash and prizes after a predetermined number of rounds is the winner.

The game is a faithful reproduction of the short-lived game show hosted by George Fenneman, although it is sometimes referred to as Surprise Package due to the "Your" on the cover being very small.

26403.name: Butterfly
26403.description:
One of the "mini spiele" series (plastic box, size approx. 6 x 4 x 2 cm). Contents: 12 plastic chips, plastic butterfly with little suspension frame.

A simple dexterity game. Players take turns to place their chips on the butterfly. If a player causes chips to fall down, the player takes those chips. The player who manages to get rid of all of her chips wins.

26404.name: Fire and Fury:  Great Western Battles Scenario Book
26404.description:
The Great Western Battles book for Fire and Fury contains orders of battle and maps for:

Shiloh
Corinth
Stones River (Murfreesboro)
Champion Hill
Chickamauga
Atlanta

Many scenarios contain special rules and "what if" variations.

The designers suggest that players play no more than one corps each, as commanding larger forces "will slow down game play".

The scenarios can be used for other systems. Stand sizes are typically 200 men, turns are 30 minutes, and distances are 1" = 66 yards.

26406.name: Fire and Fury:  Great Eastern Battles Scenario Book
26406.description:
The Great Eastern Scenario Book for Fire and Fury contains maps and orders of battle for the following:

1st Bull Run
Seven Pines
Gaines's Mill
Frayser's Farm
Cedar Mountain
2nd Bull Run
Antietam

The scenarios are generic enough that they can be adapted to other miniatures rules.

26407.name: Panacea
26407.description:
From the back of the box:

The fabled elixir of Panacea. Named after the Greek goddess of healing, its properties were to prolong life indefinitely. Alchemists have sought for this cure-all remedy for ages. Finally the time has come for you and your fellow alchemists to put the final pieces together. But only one can be first to call the Gathering of Alchemists and announce the solution to the greatest riddle of all mankind. Eternal fame and glory will be your reward. It is time for the discovery of Panacea!

Panacea is a self-released game designed by Jeph Stahl and it was distributed at Great Lakes Games IV for free to attendees. There are 50 numbered copies of the game.

26408.name: Cap Kennedy
26408.description: This building game is about the Cape Kennedy shuttle base. Each player has 25 parts (each in his color) in which he has to create a construction so that the shuttle can be launched. The player who completes the construction first wins the game. In the game, which has very simple mechanics, a die is used to determine if a part may be build. The die has colors on it, matching the 4 color of the players and 2 other color. When a die roll matches a color the part may be build. The game can be played from the young age of 5.

26409.name: Spy
26409.description:
This is a 'small' card game where each player represents a specific planet but as it goes with this type of games (and comparable to the games Mafia and Werewolves), this info is not passed on to other players. So, it's up to you to try and keep this a secret while trying to reach your goals...
What's your goal anyway? Eliminate each and every other 'foreign' player [meaning : players who don't belong to your planet] and try to end up with a group of players that all hail from the same planet.

Presented at Essen 2006 and more info on www.trof.nl

26410.name: Sanctuaries
26410.description:
Players take turns placing their set of 12 pentominoes (like Blokus) on a ten-by-ten grid in an attempt to prevent the other player from placing a piece. Unlike Blokus, there is no restriction on placement.

The "compressed game" variant takes place with a single set of pieces on an eight-by-eight subset of the board. There is also a solitaire variant, one player attempting to cover the 8x8 subset without covering the four marked center squares.

26411.name: Where On Earth Is Osama bin Laden?
26411.description:
Pass Iraq; Go Directly To Afghanistan; Find Bin Laden!
In this hilarious political satire, up to 6 players track the misadventures of the Bush Administration taking us into the wrong war in the wrong country for the wrong reasons.

Meanwhile, Osama bin Laden is peeking out of a cave on the Afghanistan-Pakistan border. Our country stinks at finding bin Laden. Can you do better?

26413.name: Truity
26413.description:
It really makes you think! A game to challenge and inspire, getting you to stand in someone else's shoes while thinking outside the square as to how to solve daily dilemmas. Designed by Lesley Williams, this product is covered by Patent, Trade Mark and Copyright, and only available through TRUITY associated websites. The game is hilariously funny, yet astounding in its ability to move peoples perspective, getting people dealing with issues in constructive ways in just minutes. Deals with all areas of life, from environmental to social, to abuse, to financial decision, there are hundreds of questions in the pack and even blank cards so that you can write your own questions for others to answer. This product was designed to stimulate the creation of new neural pathways, and develop conscious choices, this product is being used in areas of family welfare, social welfare, hospitals, mental health hospitals, correctional facilities and more.A vanity press publication supporting a psychological counselling service.

From the box:

A game to challenge and inspire.

The vision of Truity International is to inspire, mentor and facilitate people from all walks of life which includes health, peace and success.

Truity the game is a tool which leads people to develop enhanced thinking skills aligned with principles for ethical achievement. Play and enjoy.

26414.name: Capulets & Montagues
26414.description: Card game for 2-6 Players. Each player controls a noble house in 13th Century Verona Italy. Each Family is described by the Traits of: Blood, Wealth, Favor, Dignity, and Vigor. Players share a common deck. Each turn 7 cards are drawn and players take turns picking cards they want. Cards will modify a players traits up and down. The Leader in a Trait will gain Prestige Points. Vigor Determines Turn order. Blood Cards anger the Prince of the city and may lead to punishments. Favor can be used to avoid punishments. At the end of 10 turns the player with the greatest Prestige wins. Complete rules are available for free.

26415.name: Pacific Gamble
26415.description: Card Game for 2 Players. Simulation of US vs Japan in the Pacific Theater of World War II. Players share a Common deck with some cards usable by both players and some specific to one side. Win by destroying all of your opponents Fleets. Industrial Capacity is built up and damaged by both sides during play and determines Fleet Production. Air Power determines Victory in Battles. Superior Sea & Ground Forces can cause additional defeats on the loser. Superior Leadership and Intelligence factors allow extra card draws needed to win battles. Complete rule set available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Pacific.html

26416.description: Card Game for 2 Players. American Civil War Theme. Players share a common deck with cards usable by both or just 1 specific player. Win by Reducing your Opponents Morale to zero. The North can win by taking Strategic Objectives. The South can win by timely play of certain Political Recognition cards. Cards portray specific Leaders (Lee, Grant), Battles (Bull Run, Gettysburg), Strategies, Tactics, Morale, Politics, Inventions, Armies, Naval, and Economic Factors of the War. Each round, players draw and play cards. Some cards will modify or neutralize other cards or allow more or fewer cards to be drawn. The winner of a Round will lower the Morale of his opponent. Complete rule set available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TWBTS.html
26416.name: The War Between the States

26417.name: Fall of the Weimar Republic
26417.description:
Card Game simulating Politics in Germany between the two World Wars. 7 Historical Political Factions Available. Depicts the causes of Nationalism and Anarchy in pre-war Germany plus the tactics used by the Nazis to gain power. Players share a common deck and attempt to obtain legitimacy and control of certain sections of the populace (Intelligentsia, Labor Unions). Common deck Cards allow you to build up the organization (propaganda capacity) of your party and damage your rivals. Win by having the most Power when the Republic Finally collapses. Complete rule set available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/FWR.html

26418.name: Platsch
26418.description:
Called Splash in English. Listed as Haba game Nr 4377. Almost identical in concept to the 2002 game Platsch! by Haba listed as designed by Heinz Meister, where the kittens become hippos and the fish are life preservers. Very simple dice rolling game for young children.

From Game Box:
The aim of the game: 2-6 hungry kittens are trying to catch some tasty fish out of the sea. But whoever throws the dice too many times and comes too close will fall - splash! - into the water and will have to go back and take another turn.

26419.name: Iraqi Conflict
26419.description:
Card game with variants for 2-5 Players. Simulation of the post US Invasion Reconstruction Period of Iraq. Insurgency and Civil Wars are treated as separate conflicts, thus encouraging negotiations and card trading with Factions you are not directly competing against. 100 Card common Deck. Cards are specific to certain Factions. Hands are Scored at the end of every Turn. Highest total score at game end wins. Complete set of the rules are available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/IC.html

26420.description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2005/2006 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest.Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

The theme of the award was “Faeries and Legends”; F.A.T.A. ("fata" is Italian for "fairy") is a very clever and elegant card game that won hands down.

It features a deck of 110 cards. Each player belongs to a Techno-Fantasy Tribe of faeries and tries to catch the greater number of treasures by playing "tri-spells" (combination of three cards) and/or beating other players.

During his turn, the player may play a special "charm" card, then he may steal a card in front of another player (with a rock-paper-scissors system printed on the cards), then he may finally play up to two cards in front of himself.
Each player have two "virtual" columns where playing cards: the first card of a column is played normally, the second card is played rotated by 180°, the third card completes the column (the "Tri-spell") and must be placed rotated by 90°.
The three cards of a tri-spell have a different meaning: the first card is for deciding the performed action, the second for the number and kind of targets, the third for the power of the spell.

Each player have also a designed enemy (secret role assignment at the start of the game): if he defeat this player, he's the winner. If nobody reach this target, the winner is the player with the most treasure at the end of the game.

One of the authors, Martina Mealli, she's also the illustrator of the cards.
26420.name: F.A.T.A.

26421.description:
Simple trick-taking card game utilizing the UDE points cards of the World of Warcraft TCG.

All UDE Points cards can be used to play a mini-game that will change every few sets. The mini-game for the Heroes of Azeroth release is Pirates vs. Ninjas.
26421.name: Ninjas vs. Pirates

26422.name: Dream Date
26422.description: This precursor to the more famous "Mystery Date" has girls trying to literally attract boys. Players use heart-shaped magnetic pieces to navigate a clear plastic board. Under the board is a revolving cardboard circle representing the Social Circle, which contains magnetic discs of boys with whom the girl may "click" or "repel." If they click, she picks a ring for a date, and tries to avoid "obstacles" along the Valentine Path which will make the boy lose the ring. The winner is the first girl who can go out with a boy and receive the ring. Contains spinner, playing surface and circle turntable, 4 hearts, 4 cars, 4 boys, 4 rings, and 9 star-shaped obstacles.

26423.name: Magenta
26423.description: Brigade-level game on the battle of Magenta (1859), between the Austrians and the Franco-Piemontese. 1 map, 100 counters.

26424.description: Division level wargame on the Franco-Prussian War from August 1870 to February 1871 in 67 three-day turns. 1 map, 200 counters. Rules for supply, railroads, French sea movement, fortresses, and the Siege of Paris.

26425.name: Yakuza War
26425.description: Card game for 2 to 4 players. CCG type Mechanics. Set in 17th Century Japan. Each player controls a Yakuza (organized crime) group. Players are trying to kill off each others Boss. Players recruit Samurai, Ronin, Bushi, Ninja, and others to help them fight. Fight cards determine how many Units can fight in a battle. Battles are resolved by a combination of dice and card play.

26426.name: Mind Scrambler
26426.description: This game is similar to Simon ( http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/5749 , but has an interesting twist in that it involves music and a larger # of lights (5 vs. 4). But basically it is a sequence following game.

26427.name: Let's Get Personal
26427.description: Let’s Get Personal is a controversial, conversational game for adults that gives you your chance to express opinions on a wide variety of topics. Your partner must correctly guess your answer to the situation before you can continue around the unique playing board. The game is a forum for finding out more about your friends and yourself in a light-hearted format that encourages involvement without risking embarrassment.

26428.name: Het Beleggingsspel
26428.description: This game was released at the end of the '80s in Belgium and only distributed by the Generale Bank (General Bank) who gave it as a relation gift or sold it to it's customers. The goal of the game is to teach people how the stock market works.

26429.name: Carac'Terre
26429.description: This educational game released by the province of Brabant-Wallon (Waals Brabant) about that same province tells about the history, the rivers, geography, the environment and the agriculture of Brabant Wallon. The game is aimed at people from 10 years old and older.

26430.name: Ushuaïa
26430.description: Ushuaïa permits the players to dive in the world of expeditions around the world. The goal is to arrive first at the final destination. The board represents a planisphere, within the squares players can move by kayak, 4x4 car or even with a balloon. Each player draws an expedition card that determines the expedition that he has to complete (the card determines the start and finishing point). During the game players also draw adventure cards that can help or slow their expeditions.

26431.name: Bob the Builder Race Game
26431.description:
This exciting race game is full of the everyday adventures of Bob The Builder and his friends. Fixing, building and rescuing are all in a days work, join him in his adventures to get all his jobs done before he goes home.

As you race around the board you will come across some obstacles which will help and hinder you. The aim of the game is to be the first Bob to get home after finishing all your jobs.

26432.name: Match: Le Jeu de Michel Platini
26432.description: French soccer player Michel Platini was one of the most famous soccer stars from the '70s and early '80s. In 1978 a soccer game was released and licensed on Platini (with his photo on the cover). This vintage game looks quite good with 22 plastic figurines representing the soccer players. The board has a soccer field & stadium printed on it, the field is divided in squares. The game also has a die, but that die doesn't have numbers but colors on it. Collectors item, especially for soccer fans.

26433.description: Distance and track of the game is determined before the play starts. The youngest begins, rolls the die and moves his car in direction of the finish line, until the color of the die appears in the roof window. Winner is the player who drives his car through the finish gate first.
26433.name: Colo Rolo

26434.name: Monstermania
26434.description: This Monstermania Game by Louis Marx & Co. features a large upright cardboard Frankenstein face with cut outs. Behind it is a spinning wheel with various kinds of eyes, noses, and mouths. Each player has a card of a monster face and spins the wheel to win a part to complete his/her monster. Ages 5 and up.

26436.name: Euro Port Game
26436.description: Dutch game about the biggest port in the world, Rotterdam. The game was released to promote this port. With 5 different ships a player goes through every stage that a ship arriving in the Rotterdam harbor would go through. Chance cards influence the things that could happen when a ship goes from Rotterdam to another port. The value of the cargo can increase or decrease, the stock market can change, a ship could even sink or could be forced to change it's route. The moment that a player has all 5 of his ships docked the game ends. The player with the most money in the end wins.

26437.name: Invincible
26437.description:
A 32-page expansion to the CyborGladiators game that features new aliens, new cybernetics, new arena hazards, new weapons, new pre-generated gladiators as well as rules for bloodsports and battling beasts of both earthly and extraterrestrial nature.

Expands:

CyborGladiators

26439.name: dynamory
26439.description: Every player tries to get as many token (pairs) as possible. The token are stacked to build a tower at the beginning of the game and only the top token can be turned. The scope is to undo the tower as quickly as possible and distribute the token on the surface of the table. By playing clever and strategically the token can be re-covered with other token and that it will be impossible to unveil them. The difficulty of the game consists of memorizing the position of the wandering token.

26440.description: A lotto game for children with 3x3 cards depicting pictures on one side or mere silhouettes on the other and the cards to match those pictures.
26440.name: Lottino

26443.name: Feeling Lucky!
26443.description:
From http://www.hasbro.de/mcp.php/de/app/product/details/2/1412/i... and translated by Google:

Their employment asks! 6 different map and cube plays load into the schillernde world of the Casinos. With Baccarat, Blackjack, Easy Poker Dice, Michigan, Cassino or Craps becomes the living room the gaming house. Beside a Spielbrett for packs of cards is integrated special an innovative, extendable packing for the cube play Craps. Feeling Lucky - the play with Casino flair!

26444.description: Go for the runs! is a two player cricket game that is centered around the one day game. Interestingly, the back of the box states "Go for the runs! was developed over a period of 30 years by a true cricket devotee. It is for all cricket lovers, young or old." It looks like it is a game from the mid-80s.
26444.name: Go for the runs!

26445.name: Eat My Trivia
26445.description:
Eat My Trivia is touted as the world's first trivia game for gastronomes, by gastronomes.

The object of the game is to correctly answer trivia questions about the world of gastronomy, collecting points for the difficulty of each question (15 points for the quick version, 25 for the "Gourmet" version). The type and difficulty of each question is determined by a roll of the dice.

To win, one must correctly guess the name of a classic recipe after collecting the appropriate number of points.

Home Page: http://www.eatmytrivia.com

26446.description:
LovePigs (Porcellini) is a party fun game, presented as a Prototype at LuccaGames06 in Italy.
In 2007 Post Scriptum published LovePigs, in ModCon 07 the 1st National Tournament.
All PhotoReports on www.warangel.it the designer's website.

It is a game that tests the feeling between couples, partners may be: dad and daughter, wife and husband, teammates, school friends, co-workers, grandmother and nephew... The more you know about your LovePig, the more you are able to create questions that you are sure your friend answers in the way YOU will recognize, in relationship to answers given by other gamers.

Since 2010, the card game "Porcellini", same cards and illustrations, is presented by Angelo Porazzi Games in lots of Italian Fairs with simply rules for Kids, Schools, Families. You can see and read these rules in English on official page of the game

http://warangel.it/LovePigsE.html
26446.name: LovePigs (Porcellini)

boardgamehonor: 2009 Walter Luc Haas Best Simulation Winner
26447.description:
The Seven Years War In Europe, 1756-1763

Clash of Monarchs lets two to four players recreate the titantic struggle that raged across Europe and the world, pitting Frederick the Great’s Prussia and its Hanoverian allies against Maria Theresa’s Coalition of Austrian, French, Russian, Saxon, Swedish, and Holy Roman Empire forces. Each player directs the effort of one or more of the major powers, plus their minor allies, using the card-driven operations and point-to-point movement system of many of GMT’s most highly-regarded games. The cards help players enact Frederick’s pre-war invasion planning, Austrian minister Kaunitz’s diplomatic triumph in the 2nd Treaty of Versailles, the operational ascendancy of Prussian and Hanoverian light troops, formation of the Austrian General Staff, huge financial loans, court intrigue at Versailles, Vienna, and St. Petersburg, and dozens of other key political, economic, and military events. COM also uses split decks, which foster play of each power’s events in two phases -- Early War (usually through mid-1758), and Wider War (1758 to conclusion) – and allow a multi-player game to use exactly the same rules as a 2-player contest. COM augments the CDG system with a Colonial Conflict sub-game, a fully-integrated treatment of light unit operations, and a Fortunes of War chit pull, which varies the occurrence and/or timing of events beyond players’ control each year -- severe weather, desertion, attrition, possible deaths of English king George II, Empress Elizabeth of Russia, et al, and Madame Pompadour’s political influence over the French commanders, to add further uncertainty and drama to the campaigns.
26447.name: Clash of Monarchs

26448.name: Polygone
26448.description:
Each player has 12 bridges, each resting on two holes on a polygon board. Players rotate one bridge towards the opponent's side. Bridges that form closed polygons capture opponent bridges.

The player that captures 7 bridges is the winner.

26449.name: R.A.F
26449.description:
"MY KRIEG IS MORE TOTALER THAN YOUR KRIEG."

The seventies wasn't just free sex and scary looking trousers. It meant blowing things up in the name of a better, brave future. Try fighting the power - German style. An exiting, almost historical, card game.

R.A.F is a revolutionary card game that takes you back to the explosive German seventies.
Try your skills at running a terrorist group, known in German as a “Liga”. The success of your Liga is of course measured by how much publicity it gets, because as we all know: nothing has truly happened unless it happens on TV. Therefore, to win R.A.F you must collect the most Media Points. How much riot can you run before the government close you down. Teutonic Style.

26450.name: The Raven
26450.description:
This is the 6th "Bonsai Game" from daVinci, a complete games on a card (board on a side, rules on the other side), for two players.
It's a simple "hockey-style" game (played with two small coins).

26451.name: Look-Ka!
26451.description:
This is the 7th "Bonsai Game" from daVinci, a complete games on a card (board on a side, rules on the other side).
This game has been freely distributed during the 2006 edition of the "Lucca Comics & Games" event.
It's a simple "party game" for one player (based on words),
but it can be played in competitive mode with more players.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Årets Spill Best Party Game Nominee
2006 Årets Spill Best Party Game Winner
26453.description:
Reiselyst combines trivia with strategy and family games. The players travel through Europe, picking up passengers on their route and test their knowledge in geography, language and culture.

The handicap system
Choose a level, 1, 2 or 3 - easy, medium or difficult.
With its unique handicap system Reiselyst regards the players level of knowledge. The 12 year old may play against the grown ups on equal terms and the not-so-well-traveled may challenge the globetrotter in a duel.

Strategy and duel
The surprises of the game make the player's choice of route and strategy as important as the knowledge. It is not obvious that the most knowledgeable wins the game. During the game the players may challenge each other in a duel. The one who loses the duel, suffer the same fate as Napoleon and is sent to Elba...

(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)
26453.name: Reiselyst

26455.name: Kvitt eller dobbelt
26455.description:
Just as in the NRK show you have to answer questions in your favorite subject and try to reach the top with the 48 000 kroner question. You have 15 seconds to provide an answer, everything while the electronic timer plays faster and faster. Simultaneously your opponents make it even more stressful for you when they place their chance cards and thereby signal that they want to "steal" your question. The subject cards are divided in two levels of difficulty (children and adults), so that the whole family may compete at equal terms.

Experience the excitement from the TV screen and try to win as much money as possible with your knowledge. The wealthiest player wins!

(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

26456.name: Battle of the Three Emperors
26456.description: 2 Player Common deck card Game. Simulation of the Battle of Austerlitz 1805. Play as Napoleon or the Coalition. Control 3 Fronts and reduce your opponents Morale to zero to win. Cards depict Leaders, Units, Strategies, and Events. A glorious victory awaits you! A complete copy of the rules is available for free.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Wargame Nominee
26457.description:
When Alexander the Great died in 323 BC, he left no clear heir to the immense empire he had conquered. It was not long after his death that the Macedonian generals began to war among themselves over who would be the regent or successor to Alexander’s empire. By 305 BC they had given up on succession and began to carve out their own kingdoms. Successors III is a four-player game based on those wars.

Successors was first published in 1995 by Avalon Hill. Some years later a second edition rulebook was published that gave more options for the Tyche cards. Successors III builds on the foundation of the Successors II rules set plus expansion cards that appeared in the Boardgamer. Minor refinements have been made to make the game easier to play and increase enjoyment. The map is very similar to the original with some minor changes around Macedonia. Counters have the same excellent artwork for the generals and new GMT artwork for the combat units and control markers. The Tyche cards have received the most changes—nearly every card has had some minor modifications and a few new cards have been added.

In addition to the changes, the rules have been cleaned up and improved. Years of questions and answers on Consimworld have been used to clarify the rules. The rules also include hints on strategy from a number of long-time Successors players, and an extended example of play.
26457.name: Successors (third edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 13: Guilty pleasure board games
I've Been Diced! episode 15: Successors is where the love begins

26458.description:
Chandragupta brings the art of war in ancient India to GMT’s “Great Battles of History” Series. Beginning with Chandragupta Maurya’s victories over the Nanda clan, the game follows the brief but rapid rise of the Mauryan dynasty, from Chandragupta’s expulsion of Seleucus from the Indus river valley to the conquest of the last independent kingdom on the subcontinent, Kalinga, by his grandson Ashoka. The Mauryan empire became the largest and most powerful in India’s history – a distinction that would remain unchallenged until the arrival of the Mughals some 1,700 years later.

Chandragupta simulates the traditional “four-fold” division of the Indian military system, with the elephant corps reigning supreme, and the hordes of light infantry regarded as little more than fodder for chariots’ wheels and trampling pachyderms. Chariots still play a prominent role on the Indian battlefield of the era, but the cavalry, with its versatility and endurance, is a potent competitor. In Chandragupta, victory goes to the commander who can master the unique aspects of the differing Indian military “classes” – the professional, lifelong soldiers called Maulas, the mercenary levies, unpredictable tribal allies, and the militias of the powerful trade guilds. While Maulas and mercenaries are commanded under a single hierarchical command structure, the tribals and the trade guilds are led by independent chiefs.

Units include cataphracted elephants, “heavy” four- (and sometimes eight-!) wheeled chariots, and even an “elCH” unit – yes, elephant-pulled chariots. Rules include Combined Chariot/Infantry and Elephant/Infantry lines, Dharmayudda or “just” warfare, Guild enmity, and Tribal loyalty. EL units can even breach camp walls and pull down city gates (if they don’t rampage first).

Fans of GBoH will appreciate the exciting variety in Chandragupta’s scenarios, from huge set-piece battles on flat plains, to tribal suppressions, a night assault on a military camp, and street fighting in the city of Takshashila. Chandragupta is the 13th volume in the series.

Battles:


Pataliputra (319 BC) – Chandragupta’s mentor, the Brahmin Chanakya, brashly challenges the Nanda dynasty with a cadre of mercenaries.
Maghada (317 BC) – Chandragupta again confronts the Nandas, who are this time led by the formidable general Bhadrasala.
Mayalaketu (317 BC) – Chanakya attacks the turncoat general Mayalaketu and his rebel army in camp.
Takshashila (316 BC) – the Thracian general Eudamus, allied to Indian king Ambhi, defends the city of Takshashila against Chandragupta’s assault.
Gandhara (304 BC) – former officer of Alexander the Great, now “Master of Babylonia,” Seleucus I Nicator crosses the Indus river to invade Gandhara, and is confronted by the Mauryan army at the river’s banks.
Revolt in the Provinces (275 BC) – Chandragupta’s grandson, Ashoka, brings a relief force to lift a rebel siege of Takshashila and rescue the aging Chanakya who is holed up in the city’s palace.
Khashas (274 BC) – Chandragupta’s son, Bhindusara, puts down a confederation of the independent Khasha kings with an attack on their mountain strongholds.
Kalinga (261 BC) – the most famous battle of the Mauryan era, Ashoka’s army attacks the kingdom of Kalinga in a huge – and bloody -- set-piece battle.
26458.name: Chandragupta

26459.description:
PQ-17 is a 2-player game of World War II air-naval operations in the Barents and Norwegian Seas, where the Allied player strives to pass convoys to and from north Russia in the face of appalling weather and determined opposition from his Axis opponent. PQ-17 highlights the impact of reconnaissance, fuel, and the extreme climate without the drawbacks of a double-blind system or tedious bookkeeping.

Each of the 1" square ship counters in the game depicts an individual capital ship or cruiser or a group of smaller ships, submarines, or merchant vessels. Virtually every vessel that sailed arctic waters in 1942 is included, along with others that fought (or might have) in key actions. Counters are formatted much like the units in traditional block wargames, allowing step reduction to show damage or reduced numbers without cumbersome markers or rosters. These large counters never appear on the map, however; they remain off-map on players' Task Force Displays until battle is joined.

Instead, players maneuver blocks on a mapboard stretching from Greenland and Ireland to Kiel and the Kara Sea. Each block is a force of submarines or surface ships, its identity hidden from the enemy player until it is located by a successful search and the block is turned up. It may represent one ship or one hundred - or none at all, as it may be a dummy. Reconnaissance is critical, as you must locate the enemy in order to attack him. Cards are used to resolve searches quickly and efficiently: a successful search yields intelligence of varying accuracy, while failure to relocate the enemy in a timely manner results in lost contact and generation of another dummy.

Players must also cope with fuel restrictions, reflecting limited endurance (particularly for destroyers) and Axis shortages. Simple rules and the use of markers on the Task Force Displays preclude the need for record keeping while preventing unrealistic freedom of action.

To show the key role of air power in the campaign, PQ-17 also includes over 100 air units. Circular counters represent RAF Coastal Command and Fleet Air Arm squadrons and Luftwaffe Staffeln and Gruppen that participated in naval operations in the theater, as well as selected air defense units. Many VVS air regiments are also included, along with the USAAF squadrons that defended Iceland.

Because the focus of the game is operational, battles are fought on an abstract Combat Display. Simple procedures and multiple Combat Results Tables reproduce historical levels of damage from all forms of combat: submarine attacks, antisubmarine warfare, bombing and aerial torpedo attacks, anti-aircraft fire, air-to-air combat, and naval surface actions.

PQ-17's environmental model is based upon historical meteorological and oceanographic records to accurately reflect the extreme conditions and their effects. Summer operations, conducted in round-the-clock daylight, play much differently than those undertaken in the near-total darkness of winter. The polar ice pack advances and ebbs with the seasons, varying the sea routes available and posing a hazard for naval forces venturing too close. And besides each other, players must also battle some of the worst weather in the world, potentially damaging their ships and affecting movement, searches, and combat.

PQ-17 features nine historical scenarios, including all the major actions of the campaign: the Fleet Air Arm torpedo attack on Tirpitz, the decimation of convoy PQ-17, the climactic battle of PQ-18, the Battle of the Barents Sea, and the 1943 Battle of North Cape. To add uncertainty, each side is subject to a special condition in every operation, which may impose additional requirements or restrictions - or afford additional opportunities - while remaining secret from the opponent. Just like their historical counterparts, Allied players can never be certain that the Germans will not attempt to break out into the Atlantic with one or more heavy ships, and Axis players must beware of a possible attack on Norway; both players may face conflicting priorities and demands that must be met with limited resources. In addition, a 1942 "random" scenario enhances replay value by further disguising starting forces and objectives. Each operational scenario can be played to conclusion in 3-4 hours, and for players seeking a richer experience, a 1942 campaign scenario reflects the challenges of continuing operations over the course of this key year.

Game Components


One 22x34" map
58 15mm blocks
140 1" square counters
140 1/2" square counters
136 circular counters in three sizes
80 cards
One 24-page Rule Book
One 20-page Scenario Book
Two 11x17" + one or two 8.5x11" Play Aids
Two 8.5x11" Task Force Displays
One 8.5x11" Battle Display
Five 10-sided Dice


Old Home Page at Publisher: http://www.gmtgames.com/pq17/main.html
New Home Page at Publisher: http://www.gmtgames.com/p-126-pq-17.aspx
26459.name: PQ-17: Arctic Naval Operations 1941-43

26460.name: Tumble Bumble Game
26460.description:
"THEY TUMBLE DOWN, IT'S A FUNNY SIGHT
TRYING TO FIND THE HOLE THAT'S RIGHT!"

From the box:

The Bumbles tumble down the slides onto the rink. Over and over they go ... all going for the one open hole in the center. PLOPP!! You land in the hole and score! Beware of the side holes, though, because if you land in them, you'll lose points. First player to get a score of (10) wins this hilarious game!

The 13" plastic circular gameboard has a small knob at the center which is attached to an incomplete platform that can rotate beneath the playing surface. There are four symmetrically positioned large holes in the central area of the playing surface; the underlying platform prevents any more than one of these from being open at any particular time. There are four similarly sized holes towards the perimeter of the rink. In each quadrant around the perimeter of the board there is an area for scoring and a small hole to secure individual bumble slides.

Players take turns to spin the platform. When the platform is spun, players attempt to land their bumble in the hole. Bumbles are introduced into the rink from player's slides. If a bumble successfully finds a central hole that is open, that player scores a point for the round. Any bumbles landing in the holes located near the perimeter of the rink lose a point for their player.

The first player to reach ten points is the winner.

26461.name: Koo Koo Choo Choo
26461.description:
From the box:

'Suspense ... which way will CHOO CHOO go from the center? Where will it be when the "TNT" explodes?

Strategy ... to score points, place railroad crossing danger sign where you think "TNT" will explode.

Skill ... switch fast ... out of your section ... when the little CHOO CHOO chugs into your territory.

BE QUICK TO SWITCH OR ELSE!'

The game comes in a large 15" square x 5.5" high box and is a huge 30" square when assembled. Each player controls a quadrant of the gameboard track. The clockwork engine, which ejects an 'exploding' piece of dynamite when the mechanism runs down, must be manipulated into opponents' areas by switching the direction of travel. Points are scored relative to the area where the explosion occurs. The engine is then rewound, the dynamite replaced and the procedure repeated.

The first player to amass ten points is the winner.

26462.name: Bark n' Bite Game
26462.description:
"Be quick as a flash, deliver the mail,
Avoid the dog, or you will fail."

The game comes in a 15" square box, which is the size of the colorful gameboard. At the center of the gameboard is a plastic house with an inner rotating frame where a plastic dog is placed and locked in position. There is a small hole in the roof of the house where a rubber squeeze bulb is inserted; this is used to both simulate canine noises when squeezed and propel the dog from the house when hit with force.

Players must attempt to deliver five letters whilst avoiding the dog; the first to do so wins the game.

26463.name: Catch a Crook Game
26463.description:
"CATCH THE CROOK WHEN HE POPS
BE THE QUICKEST OF THE COPS"

From the box:

All eyes are on the Crook ... when will he pop? ZOOM! There he goes ... everyone grabs for him! Sharp eyes with quick reflexes are needed here. Catch the Crook when he pops then you can move your Cop along the board toward the Crook's Hideout. Be careful though, you must finish your move before he pops again. If you don't ... back you go! The first player to reach the Crook's Hideout wins the game!

A plastic figure about 5" high representing the crook is attached to a suction-loaded spring device and placed in the center of the colorful gameboard after being 'set'. Players may roll the die as many times as they wish on their turn, but if the suction device releases before the player has declared their move finished no rolls for that turn count. Whoever catches the plastic crook has the next turn.

The first player to move their plastic 'cop' along the game path from the Jail house to the Crook's Hideout is the winner of the game.

26464.description:
"WHEN CASPER LIGHTS UP, YOU WIN A CHIP"

From the box:

A game of chance based on the popular, lovable Casper character. Players compete to win chips by making Casper light up. All parts glow in the dark. Requires one AA-type battery.

Each player is given a 'spooky stone' (a piece of molded plastic with four symmetrically positioned holes); Casper and the chips are placed in the center of the playing area. A turn simply comprises placing Casper on any other player's spooky stone. If he lights up, the player wins a chip. The player may elect to stop and keep the chip won, or risk it and try Casper on a different player's spooky stone. This may be repeated a third and final time, but if Casper fails to light up at any stage the player's turn is over and all chips won that turn are returned to the center pile.

The first player to win four chips wins the game.
26464.name: Casper the Friendly Ghost Game

26465.name: Babysitter Game
26465.description:
"If you wake the baby ... he'll YELL!"

From the box:

Everyone becomes a baby sitter when he plays this fast moving, money earning game. Each player tries to perform tasks without waking up little 'STANLEY', a light sleeper, who is sleeping peacefully in his crib. The players earn money for each task they perform while baby-sitting. Every time little 'STANLEY' jumps up and yells, players lose money.

The game comes in a huge (15" x 21" x 4") box. The large elaborate molded plastic gameboard features a complicated mechanism beneath the surface which is responsible for setting the tasks which will not be completed successfully. The gameboard depicts Stanley's room; Stanley is in his centrally located crib which is surrounded by a circle of 16 holes where the various task symbols are inserted. These holes are in turn are surrounded by a circle of 20 holes - 16 corresponding task peg holes and 4 chore holes.

Players are dealt three cards at the start of the game and draw another (or more if needed) at the start of each turn to give a total of four; these are used in gameplay to either perform tasks to earn money, or hinder other players while performing their tasks.

The active player receives the task pegs and inserts pegs into the corresponding task peg hole when required. Up to three tasks may be attempted per turn, depending on the cards held. 25 cents is awarded for the first task completed successfully, 50 cents for the second and one dollar for the third. If however Stanley pops up and 'cries', all money earned that turn is lost.

The game is over when there is no money left for distribution. Players total their earnings and the player with the highest amount is the winner.

26466.description:
In "3 Tage im Mai" you lead a group of citizens to the Hambacher Schloss in a march for democracy.
This event actually took place in Germany 1832 and is regarded as the starting point of the democratic movement in Germany.
You move your citizens with movement cards in a system just like "Cartagena".
In order to gain new cards, you have to move backwards onto so-called gathering-points. Here you have to answer trivia questions concerning the revolution.
After a fixed length of 9 turns, the player with the most citizens in the Hambacher Schloss wins the game.

There is a special variant for "young democrats", so children from the age of 6 may play.
26466.name: 3 Tage im Mai

26467.name: Espias y confidentes
26467.description:
Spanish game in early 70's. The players are spies what must travel through Europe looking for the keys to discover his own secret code. The first player that travel to Ginebra and correctly guess his own code, wins the game!.

Juego español de la década de los 70. Los jugadores son espias que deben recorrer Europa consiguiendo de los confidentes las claves que les permitan descubrir su código secreto. El primer jugador que viaje a Ginebra y adivine su código correctamente, ¡será el ganador de la partida!

26468.name: Klaverjassen
26468.description:
Klaverjassen is one of the most popular card games in the Netherlands, traditionally played in cafes and social clubs, as well as at home. The game is for 4 players who play in pairs, sitting opposite each other.

A 32 card pack is used, consisting of the cards A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7

The game has a number of variants, named after the cities where they originated: Amsterdam, Rotterdam and Utrecht

26469.name: El Chino
26469.description:
Spanish game for adults from the early 80s with ambiance in the "Barrio Chino" (Chinese Neighborhood, Spanish term for red light district) of Barcelona. With a mechanics like the Monopoly, the players play the role of prostitutes (whores), thieves and transsexuals.
The goal of this game is earn more money than others players(stealing, selling drugs or having sex) in a limit of time what must be choose by the players at the start of game.

Juego español para adultos de principios de los 80 ambientado en el "Barrio Chino" de Barcelona, centro en aquella época de prostitución y drogas. Con una mecánica similar a la del Monopoly, los jugadores son prostitutas, chulos navajeros y travestis que deben ganar más dinero que los demás (robando, vendiendo drogas o acostándose con clientes) en un límite de tiempo que debe ser escogido en común por los jugadores al principio.

From "The New Spaniards" (Penguin Politics and Current Affairs version) by John Hooper pg. 150:


In a historic lapse of taste, a board game called El Chino was marketed in Spain in the early eighties. Players moved pieces representing pimps, whores and transvestites. Those unlucky enough to catch a venereal disease had to be moved to a square marked 'clinic'

boardgamehonor: 2008 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
26472.description:
Dragon Parade is a simple game by Reiner Knizia which is played on a small, beautifully decorated board depicting Chinese New Year fireworks in and around the Forbidden City.

Players alternate playing cards to move the dragon pawn back and forth along the street in front of the Forbidden Palace: red cards to move it one direction, yellow to move it the other. Each player gets a random hand of six movement cards and will play only four of them before the dragon's final position is settled.

Players individually deploy their three pawns ("street sellers") somewhere along the red/yellow number line, one at a time after each of the first three cards played, in the effort to be nearest to the dragon once it stops moving. Then coins (VP) are collected by each street seller depending on proximity to the dragon, the top payoff of 5 going only to the pawn on the exact same space.

You play as many hands as there are players, with each player going first once. It's a game of groupthink and should move pretty quickly once everyone gives in to the idea that it's not an exact science!
26472.name: Dragon Parade
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 32 - Knizia on Ingenious Puzzles, plus Dragon Parade, Escalation and Mmm...Brains

26473.name: DiceWarGame
26473.description:
Iconic dice (showing modern warfare units and tactics) and a straightforward paper-rock-scissors mechanic. Dicewargame is for military enthusiasts who want to give their brains a rest from hardcore strategy.

The object is to either capture cities (best accomplished with infantry)or destroy your opponent's army. Surrender is also an option and a valid one given that you can set-up and start another game in under a minute.

Each turn a player either attacks, re-rolls or withdraws. This provides a variety of tactical options.

Once you get to grips with 'who-does-what-to-who', play tends to be quite fast. It is best played as 'best of five' or in a match of games and sets.

Available as a download from Wargame Vault

26474.name: Cold War Commander
26474.description:
Cold War Commander is a wargame that allows you to re-create battles from the First Indo-China War right up to the present day using miniatures on a tabletop. Command anything from a company right up to a division and get a result in 2-3 hours. Suitable for any scale miniatures from 2mm right up to 28mm and no re-basing required.

The rules come as a 140-page A4-sized bound book with over 60 full color pictures. These feature real miniatures as you see them on the gaming table. You also get a double-sided A4-sized quick reference sheet.

The main features of the game include:


Command system that emphasizes the fog of war in a simple but effective manner.
The same mechanism for casualty resolution throughout.
Rules for infantry, tanks, artillery, aircraft, helicopters, missiles, engineers and fortifications.
Flexible figure ratio meaning a base of infantry represents either a section or a platoon.
Minimal set-up time - simply assemble your forces and play.
Unique points system that allows for unequal forces but an equal chance of victory.
33 well-presented army lists for 28 nations covering 12 conflicts.
16 generic scenarios suitable for any nation & theater plus a simple campaign system.
Suitable for solo, 2-player & multi-player games at home, club, or tournament.
One double-sided quick reference sheet included.
No supplements - all you need to play in one book.

26475.name: Programmed Wargames Scenarios
26475.description:
From the book cover:

"Battles and campaigns for solo and multi-player wargamers -- with programmed enemy deployment, orders and responses for one or both sides."

The 18 scenarios and two mini-campaigns can be set in three time periods: "Ancient", "Horse and Musket", and "Modern."

26476.name: MarketPlace
26476.description:
Based on a real-life online restaurant reservation business, MarketPlace aims to provide a new and exciting way of teaching entrepreneurial skills at all levels.

The game focuses on key marketing concepts: features, benefits, needs and objectives. Participants are divided in 2 groups. One group are the ‘sellers’; and the other group are the ‘purchasers’. The sellers then make their pitch, elicit needs and encounter objections from the purchasers.

26477.name: Great Battles of World War Two: Volume I – The Canadians in Europe
boardgamefamily: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules Series
26477.description:
From the

Bruce McFarlane's 4th miniatures guide-book covering large battles.

Each stand represents a company with maneuver elements being battalions.

The scale and scope of the game allows multi-divisional actions simulating weeks not minutes.

There is no game out there like Great Battles of World War II.
Canadian History, Organization, Weapons and Tactics.

A simple yet revolutionary rules set; 8 Scenarios
Dieppe, Agira, Ortona, Juno Beach, Falaise (Totalize I, Totalize II, Tractable) & Hochwald

26478.name: Great Battles of World War Two: Volume II – Drop Zone
boardgamefamily: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules Series
26478.description:
From the introduction:

Drop Zone - Introduction

As was indicated by our labeling our first publication, "Great Battles of World War II - Volume 1", we always intended to publish more additions and make a series of the rules. The question quickly arose; which topic, era, theater etc. should our second volume cover? We wanted something limited in scope, but that would offer a good number of ping-pong table sized battles. We also prefer to do subjects that have not been yet covered in miniatures. Island War came immediately to mind. The battles of the Pacific islands would certainly provide the proper size actions and only a game of Great Battles scope could cover the forces and time scales needed. Finally, we could include a Canadian action (Hong Kong) - always a bonus in our view. There was also German operations in Poland, France and the Mediterranean. Finally, of course there was the whole Eastern Front to choose from. We felt, however, that we should experiment more with the system before we wrote the definitive scenario book for WWII miniatures gamers - the Steppes of Russia.

I think it was Marcel Van der Sleen who first floated the idea that Great Battles was the perfect vehicle to present airborne actions. He had done a fair bit of work on Operation Market Garden and insisted that Great Battle's scope and time scale could be worked into three or four linked scenarios leading to a grand-campaign that would reflect the whole operation. In addition, Marcel claimed that very few adjustments would be needed. The movement, combat and morale would be left unchanged. We had already worked with the basic organizations in Canadians in Europe. He was correct. Great Battles remained unchanged, throughout the project. The only differences were the additions of landing rules and the use of activation cards instead of a set number of activation points.

Once into the research, I found that not only did the airborne operations offer interesting scenarios, but there was "a little bit for everyone". There are air-drops of course but also tank-to-tank confrontations, elite units, militia units, street fighting, battalion operations, division operation and even corps operations. In addition, the Operations Mercury (Crete) and Operation Market Garden (Holland) could be linked into a grand campaign using defined battlefields (ping-pong tables) but allowing for area-to-area movement between tables - a rarity in miniatures gaming.

Ultimately, we feel that Drop Zone offers a different type of miniatures scenarios. Those that have played Canadians in Europe will immediately notice the difference, in texture, between the set-piece co-ordinated attack-defend actions and the tenuous, nail-biting to-and-fro of an airborne operation. For those who have not played the other scenarios in this series, be prepared for a new gaming experience. Your games will not simulate a 40 minute fight for the local farmhouse or crossroads. Instead, you will have to plan a multi-day operation - to land parachute brigades or even divisions behind enemy lines and then relieve them. Great Battles puts you in the general's chair where deployment and activation of forces, weather, supply, recovery and reinforcements artillery and air support are more important than the penetrating power of a shell or the armor thickness of a turret.

We are quite proud of Drop Zone and very pleased that Great Battles has made the transition to this new topic with such ease. We look forward to exploring other eras and theaters with Great Battles of World War II.

26479.description:
Armored Assault is the first expansion to Battle Armor.

Jones ducked back into the gravity tank as the communication link started blasting orders. Damn Federation troopers were on their way, so he and the rest of the unit had been ordered to the front lines to meet them. Gee, five light gravity tanks against a small squad of power armored troopers, it just didn't seem fair. What had he ever done bad to deserve this?

Armored Assault is the first expansion for the Battle Armor game system. Within these pages you will find rules for adding heavy tanks and gravity-propelled vehicles to your futuristic battles fields.

One of many Mini-games from Bad Baby, this and others like it will take you on short, fast paced gaming adventures, and for only a few bucks.

This is not a stand alone game and require that you have a copy of Bad Baby's Mini-game Battle Armor.

Expands:

Battle Armor
26479.name: Armored Assault

26480.description:
Jarn watched as the orc hoard rushed forward, heading right for him and the other elves standing beside him. They all stood in a straight line before their sacred forest home, each having sworn an oath to protect it from these foul folk.

Overhead the high elven king rode the winds upon the back of his dragon steed, but even with such a mighty beast on their side, Jarn did not think he and the other elves would hold the day. The mass of green orcs were to many he feared, and his folk far to few.

Realms is the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Take the side of the bright elven nations or the foul orc hoards, as the two battle for control of the world.

A fast paced fantasy game of warfare, spells, magical items and mighty beasts, all will be under you control as you battle your foe. Can you out last, out fight and out maneuver your enemy, or will you fall to their sharp edged sword.
26480.name: Realms: Elves & Orcs

26481.name: Don't Quote Me: TV Guide Edition
26481.description:
By successfully identifying famous (and not so famous) quotations, players move their pawns around a pentagonal board. Players move three spaces by guessing without taking a hint, two spaces with one hint, or one space for picking the right answer from a multiple choice list. The first player around the board wins.

The categories are:

Comedy (Sitcoms, Variety Shows)

Drama (Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Western, Romance)

News/Talk/Sports (World Events, Politicians, Newscasters, Talk Shows, Sports Figures)

Movies (Movies, Movie Tag Lines)

Stay Tuned (Cartoons, Children's Programs, Game Shows, Reality Shows, Commercials)

Home Page: http://dontquoteme.com/

26484.name: Top Careers In Science
26484.description:
Top Careers In Science is first in a new series of educational games from LOOP Card Games (UK) based on the popular Top Trumps system.

Players attempt to obtain the entire stack of cards by calling out and comparing specific attributes from the cards... the player holding the card with the highest value of that attribute wins all of the cards in the round, and the player who eventually wins all the cards, wins the game.

Each custom-illustrated card displays information on a specific career in the Sciences, with number values attributed to a variety of career-related attributes. Each card is sponsored or supported by a prominent employer in the related field, and provides website information which might help students further their interest towards a career in that field.

26485.name: M&M/Mars Attacks!
26485.description:
Appeared in the September 2000 issue of Shred Magazine.

"The world's first CCG (Collectible Candy Game)."

"Miniatures combat game depicting the deadly battle between mankind's own saucer fleet, designed in the wake of the Roswell crash, and an invading armada from the Red Planet. It's intended to offer minutes of delectable, candy-coated warfare, followed by a coup-de-grace you can really savor."

You need the board (included in the magazine), 2D6 and at least two kinds of M&M's (saucers).

Object: To either penetrate your opponent's defenses and bombard their home world or to destroy (and consume) the entire enemy fleet.

Fleets are made of 2 different kinds of M&M's (one kind for each player) - the bigger they are (say, Peanut M&M's as opposed to Plain M&M's), the more resistant they are to damage, but the slower they move. Color determines weapons abilities.

Assemble your fleet of 10 M&M's of one kind (color combination of your choosing) and place them on your base. The Earth player gets two more on the moon.

Saucers move and engage in combat, resolved by rolling the 2D6 and using combat tables. Space and Ground attacks are possible (saucers can attack a planet). Planets have different defense capabilities.

There are also rules for ramming.

26486.description:
The 14th and 15th battle of the Jours de Gloire series, this one's a DTP effort from Canons en Carton.

SYSTEM: Jours de Gloire Series (JDG)
- scale = 297 m/hex;
- time = 75 min/GT;
- strength = 200 men/SP.
26486.name: Maida and Castel Nuovo, 1806

26487.name: Huzzah!
boardgameimplementation: Huzzah! Four Battles of the American Civil War Vol. 1
26487.description:
Huzzah! comprises two games in the new Rebel Yell Lite System.

1) Rosey and the Woodpecker, the battle of Iuka, MS, September 19, 1862
2) Old Burn at Newbern, the battle of Newbern, NC, March 14, 1862

Game components:
2 11x17 maps depicting the environs of Iuka and Newbern at between 150-200 yards per hex
A 25 page battle manual (rules of play) with Designers Notes, Index & Glossary, and Bibliography.
A 15 page scenario booklet with historical commentary that places each game in a strategic context. It also includes Hints on Play to step first time players through a range of possible strategies
260+ double-sided, mounted, and cut counters. Nothing to assemble or punch out! Each combat unit beautifully renders period state or national flags
2 Chart and Tables reference cards summarizing the most important elements of the game
Game unit manifest and Orders of Battle

Important: the players must supply their own game dice (2 ten-sided and at least 3 six-sided dice are recommended)

26488.name: Italian Wars
26488.description:
Two Player card game depicting a battle as fought in the Renaissance Era.

The battle is fought over a series of Hands. The first to win 8 hands or 3 in a row wins the field.

Period representative cards depict Leaders, Infantry, Artillery, Cavalry, Terrain, Morale, and Tactics. All cards interact in some way directly with other cards.

26489.name: Seven Years War
26489.description: Two Player card game simulating the Seven Years War 1756-1763 between the English & French Alliances. Compete for influence in: Europe, North America, India, and the West Indies. Players share a common deck but with cards specific to certain players and campaigns. Victory can be achieved in Europe or the Colonies. A complete copy of the rules can be had for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/7YW.html

26490.name: Trafalgar
26490.description: Card game for 2 Players simulating the Naval Battle of Trafalgar 1805. Be the first to win 3 Hands in a row. Poker type mechanics. Common deck with 4 Suites: Strategy, Tactics, Morale, and Fighting. Extra card interaction to keep things interesting. Designed to be an even match. A Complete copy of the rules can be seen at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Trafalgar.html

26491.name: Operation Solstice
26491.description: This game is also called Operation Sonnenwende. 200 DTP counters The game depicts the 11Pz SS Army attack in Pomerania on February 15, 1945. This offensive had the purpose of hitting th weaker Russian Northern flank of the future drive to Berlin which was strung out a very long front ending on the Oder river. The offensive was planned by Heinz Guderian. The Germans were able to assemble 200 tanks unknown to the Russians, achieved tactical surprise and managed to reach one of its objective, the city of Arnswalde and to save the encircled garrison, but they did not advance much further. (batallion, regiment size units with some companies for the Germans, regiment, and brigade size units for the Russians), one 11 X 17 map.

26492.description: Miniatures/Wargame for 2 or more players. Compatible with DBA Army lists. Grid or Hex Map. Players share a common deck. Cards are used to Move, Attack, and Defend. No Dice. Auto-Kill rules make for a quick game. Crusader Campaign Setting Included. See Web Links for rules.
26492.name: Ancient Warfare

26493.name: Space Dreadnought 3000
26493.description:
Space Dreadnought 3000 is a fast play game in which military and economic conflicts are fought out and decided through strategic skill and daring. Battlefleets leap across light years to compete for control of strategic stars and star-clusters.

Contents: 48-page rules booklet. Counters are provided for play without miniatures.

The rules are designed for use with Kallistra's Space Dreadnought 3000 1/3000 scale starships and 1/600 scale fighters, but spaceship models from any manufacturer may be substituted. A model represents one ship or a large number of fighters.

A 6ft x 4ft table is required if using miniatures or 3.5ft x 2.5ft table if using counters.

Rules are included for playing Tactical, Strategic and Campaign Games.

The TACTICAL GAME is played for 10 turns. Each turn is composed of the following steps:

1. Secretly write movement orders
2. Simultaneously execute movement orders
3. Secretly write combat orders
4. Resolve combat

Ships are grouped into fleets which move together between a dozen or so giant hexes representing a star system. The hexes are positioned in any of ten recommended configurations. The hexes are not arranged in a hex grid, but rather form paths or rings. Fleets unable to trace an uncontested path to a supply planet hex are at an extreme disadvantage in combat.

Aggressive movement plots can have dire consequences; fleets plotted to move THROUGH hexes occupied by a NON-MOVING enemy fleet are summarily destroyed.

Opposing fleets in the same hex battle. There is no movement during battle. Players simply roll a twelve sided die for each attacking ship and reference the ship's offensive table. The result is compared to the target's defenses. Combat may last several rounds until one side is destroyed or withdraws.

After 10 turns, the player with the greatest point value for all surviving ships is the winner.

The STRATEGIC GAME includes a couple scenarios played out using tactical rules.

The CAMPAIGN GAME is played on an area map for which players fight for supremacy. Each area represents a star system. Players may build naval bases. Conflict is resolved by playing a tactical game.

Optional rules include supply ships, command and control, alliances, team-play and multi-force campaigns.

26494.description: Wargame for 2-5 Players. England circa 800-1000 AD. Players can choose to be: Vikings, Anglo-Saxons, Welsh, Scots, or Picts. Area Map. Racial Special Abilities. No Dice. Simple rules for Unit recruitment & Movement. Players share a common deck which is used to resolve Battles. Card types include: Warrior, Weapon, Armor, Fort, & Siege. Conquer the most territory in 10 turns. Complete copy of the rules available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/EKE.html
26494.name: Early Kings of England

26495.name: Hundred Years War
